Full Paragraph Text: The business environment was again marked by great uncertainty in 2014. Disruptive socio-economic and political change continued to affect growth in many parts of the world. In the emerging markets, economic volatility worsened as growth rates slowed and currencies weakened. In the developed markets, deflationary pressures and soft consumer demand resulted in a continued challenging trading environment. In the face of such uncertainty it was more important than ever to stay the course and remain loyal to our strategy, driving short-term performance while ensuring we made the right decisions to deliver our long-term goals. We took decisive steps to further our ambition to be the world’s recognised leading Nutrition, Health and Wellness company, trusted by all stakeholders, while again delivering financial results in 2014 that outperformed the market.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Financial results delivered in 2014 and short-term performance driving; Long-Term: Long-term goals and ambition to be world's leading company over decades
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Short-term performance drives decisions to achieve long-term strategic goals.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly connects short-term performance driving with ensuring right decisions for long-term goal delivery. This creates a clear causal link where immediate actions influence decade-spanning objectives.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: “Remain loyal to our strategy” implies a multi‑year strategy.; Short-Term: “Driving short-term performance” and “financial results in 2014.”; Long-Term: “Deliver our long-term goals.”
gpt5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Short-Term, Long-Term] Loyalty to a multi-year strategy drove short-term performance, and short-term decisions were to deliver long-term goals.
gpt5: Rationale: The text states strategy loyalty drove short-term performance, creating a Medium→Short link. It also says current decisions ensure delivery of long-term goals, forming a Short→Long link. No other explicit cross-scale causality is stated.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Financial results in 2014 that outperformed the market.; Long-Term: Ensuring decisions to deliver long-term goals.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Short-term performance was driven to ensure long-term goals.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links short-term performance in 2014 to ensuring long-term goals. The focus on immediate financial results is causally tied to achieving broader, long-term ambitions.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Short-term decisions and steps taken in 2014 were explicitly aimed at delivering long-term goals and furthering the company's ambition.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph clearly establishes a causal link where actions and decisions made in 2014 (Short-Term) are explicitly stated as being taken to achieve 'long-term goals' and 'further ambition' (Long-Term). No other cross-scale interactions, particularly involving the Medium-Term, were explicitly described with a causal relationship.

Full Paragraph Text: Through continuous innovation and renovation of our food and beverages portfolio we are able to offer people healthier and tastier choices at every stage of their life, at any time of the day. Science-based innovation enables us to enhance the quality of people’s diets, using our knowledge and our research and development capability to make a positive contribution to society. Wherever you are in the world, we have safe, nutritious products to help you care for yourself and your family. A few years ago, we expanded the boundaries of Nutrition, Health and Wellness with the creation of Nestlé Health Science, motivated by the opportunity to forge a major therapeutic role for nutrition in the management of health. In line with this broadened strategy, in 2014 the Board approved the sale of 48.5 million L’Oréal shares to L’Oréal for cancellation. Part of the proceeds were used for the acquisition of the 50% stake in our joint venture Galderma from L’Oréal, bringing our ownership of Galderma to 100%. Galderma formed the foundation of a new Nestlé subsidiary, Nestlé Skin Health. Its goal is to be recognised as the leading company in skin health, offering science-based solutions to protect, nourish and enhance skin, and where needed to treat, correct and restore damaged skin over the course of people’s lives. Nestlé Skin Health provides prescription drugs, self-medication, therapeutic skin care and aesthetic and corrective medicine, allowing us to compete in the growing and promising multi-billion global skincare market. Nestlé Skin Health was further strengthened by the acquisition of the full rights to commercialise several key aesthetic dermatology products in the United States and Canada.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: 2014 Board approval of L'Oréal share sale and Galderma acquisition; Long-Term: Continuous innovation over people's lifetimes and long-term skin health strategy
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Strategic acquisitions in 2014 enabled lifetime skin health solutions
claude4: Rationale: The 2014 Board decisions to sell L'Oréal shares and acquire Galderma directly enabled Nestlé's long-term strategy to provide skin health solutions 'over the course of people's lives.' This represents a clear causal link from short-term corporate actions to long-term strategic positioning.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: 'A few years ago' broadened strategy/creation of Nestlé Health Science.; Short-Term: In 2014 the Board approved the L’Oréal share sale.; Long-Term: References to a 'growing ... global skincare market' and 'over the course of people’s lives'.
gpt5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Short-Term, Long-Term] A few-years-old strategy led to a 2014 share sale; Skin Health’s offerings then allow competition in a growing long-run skincare market.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links a multi-year strategy to a 2014 transaction. It also states that current product provision enables competition in a growing market, tying short-term capability to a long-term trend. Other mentions lack explicit cross-scale causality.
4o: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: The acquisition of Galderma and creation of Nestlé Skin Health occurred over a few years.; Long-Term: Nestlé Skin Health aims to treat and restore skin over the course of people's lives.
4o: Summary: [Medium-Term, Long-Term] The acquisition of Galderma aims to impact skin health over people's lives, showing a cross-scale interaction.
4o: Rationale: The acquisition of Galderma and creation of Nestlé Skin Health are medium-term actions intended to have long-term impacts on skin health. This demonstrates a clear cross-scale interaction from medium-term strategic actions to long-term health outcomes.
gemini2.5: Links: Medium-Term -> Long-Term | Medium-Term -> Short-Term | Short-Term -> Long-Term
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Specific events in 2014, such as the share sale and subsidiary formation.; Medium-Term: The creation of Nestlé Health Science 'a few years ago' and its broadened strategy.; Long-Term: Strategic goals like 'forge a major therapeutic role' and 'leading company... over the course of people’s lives'.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term, Long-Term] A medium-term strategy led to short-term corporate actions, which in turn established a new subsidiary with long-term market leadership goals.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The Medium-Term creation of Nestlé Health Science initiated a strategy influencing Short-Term corporate actions, like the 2014 share sale and formation of Nestlé Skin Health. This Short-Term entity was established with a Long-Term goal of market leadership. A separate Medium-Term to Long-Term link exists, as the initial creation was motivated by a long-term therapeutic vision.

Full Paragraph Text: These developments ensure that, building on the strong foundations of our food and beverages business and guided increasingly by science, we can further expand our portfolio to provide promising platforms for future growth in line with our strategy of Nutrition, Health and Wellness. At the same time, we continue the drive to ensure our company is organised efficiently and effectively to deliver continuous profitable growth over the long term. With this objective in mind we made some key decisions, adapting our organisational structure to better prepare ourselves today to meet the challenges of tomorrow.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Key decisions and organizational structure adaptations made 'today'; Long-Term: Continuous profitable growth 'over the long term' and meeting 'challenges of tomorrow'
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Current organizational decisions drive long-term profitable growth and future preparedness.
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly states that present-day organizational structure adaptations are made to prepare for future challenges and deliver long-term growth. This creates a clear causal link from short-term actions to long-term outcomes.

gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Today’s organisational decisions are intended to secure continuous profitable growth over the long term.
gpt5: Rationale: The text ties immediate organisational decisions (“today”) to achieving “continuous profitable growth over the long term,” creating a causal short-to-long link. Other future references lack specific durations.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Adapting our organisational structure today.; Long-Term: Deliver continuous profitable growth over the long term.

Full Paragraph Text: While our company continues to benefit from its decentralised structure, allowing key decisions to be made as close as possible to consumers, there is still an important opportunity to better leverage our scale. That is why in 2014 we set up Nestlé Business Excellence at Executive Board Level, combining GLOBE (Nestlé’s Global Business Excellence function) with Nestlé Business Services (our shared operation for transactional services around the world) and Nestlé Con tinuous Excellence (our continuous improvement and LEAN programme). Through a focus on three areas: Simplifying, Standardising and Sharing, Nestlé Business Excellence will allow us to decrease structural costs and operational expenses, freeing up resources to support growth. This will also allow our markets to keep a sharp focus on generating demand.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Setting up Nestlé Business Excellence in 2014 represents a specific organizational change; Long-Term: Decreasing structural costs and freeing up resources for growth represents ongoing strategic benefits
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] 2014 organizational restructuring enables ongoing cost reduction and growth resource allocation.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph shows how a specific 2014 organizational change (Short-Term) causally leads to ongoing structural cost decreases and resource reallocation for growth (Long-Term). The causal link is explicit through 'will allow us to decrease' phrasing.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: In 2014 we set up Nestlé Business Excellence (dated, discrete action).; Medium-Term: Focus on simplifying, standardising and sharing to decrease structural costs and operational expenses.
gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] The 2014 setup enables multi-year cost efficiencies, which in turn let markets focus on near-term demand generation.
gpt5: Rationale: A dated 2014 action creates an efficiency program that reduces structural costs, implying a multi-year transition. Those efficiencies then enable immediate operational focus on demand. No other explicit cross-scale links appear.

4o: Rationale: The establishment of Nestlé Business Excellence in 2014 is a long-term strategy that causally influences short-term outcomes like decreased costs. The text explicitly links these scales through the setup and its immediate effects on costs.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: The 'decentralised structure' is described as a continuous, long-standing characteristic of the company, implying a duration over decades.; Medium-Term: The 'setup of Nestlé Business Excellence in 2014' is a strategic initiative with multi-year goals like 'decrease structural costs' and 'support growth'.

gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links the identification of an opportunity (arising in the context of the long-term decentralised structure) to the medium-term strategic action of setting up Nestlé Business Excellence. No other explicit cross-scale causal links were identified, as the effects of the medium-term initiative are also described within the medium-term horizon.

Full Paragraph Text: We have integrated the Maghreb, the Middle East, the North East Africa region, Turkey and Israel into Zone Europe to form Zone EMENA (Europe, Middle East and North Africa). This balances the different consumer dynamics and opportunities in each geography. Additionally it allows a sharper focus in Zone Asia, Oceania and Africa, a fast-growing part
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a completed organizational restructuring without temporal markers or causal relationships between different time scales. It presents the integration as an accomplished fact rather than a process unfolding across time periods.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit timeframes beyond an immediate restructuring; claimed benefits lack defined durations, so no cross-scale causal link can be established.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a structural integration without explicit temporal scales or causal cross-scale interactions.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: The phrase 'fast-growing part' implies a sustained trend over many years, fitting the description of processes unfolding over decades.; Medium-Term: The 'sharper focus' is a strategic outcome of an organizational change, typically a a multi-year transition or strategy.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Long-Term, Medium-Term] A region's long-term growth trend influences the medium-term strategic decision to sharpen focus in that area.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes an organizational restructuring. While the restructuring itself and its immediate benefits are medium-term, the rationale for a 'sharper focus' in Zone Asia, Oceania and Africa is explicitly tied to it being 'a fast-growing part'. This 'fast-growing' characteristic represents a long-term trend that influences the medium-term strategic allocation of attention.

Full Paragraph Text: The new Nestlé Business Excellence function is led by Chris Johnson, the former head of Zone Americas. Zone Americas is now led by Laurent Freixe, the former head of Zone Europe, and the new Zone EMENA by Luis Cantarell, who previously was in charge of Nestlé Nutrition and Nestlé Health Science. The new head of Nestlé Nutrition is Heiko Schipper, who was formerly responsible for our Global Infant Nutrition division. Nestlé Health Science is led by Greg Behar, who joined the company from Boehringer Ingelheim in July. The newly established Nestlé Skin Health is led by Humberto Antunes, former ly the Chief Executive Officer of our joint venture Galderma.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes organizational restructuring and leadership appointments but contains no temporal information about when these changes occurred or their duration. Without explicit timeframes, no temporal scales can be identified or linked.

There are no explicit mentions of processes or events at Medium-Term or Long-Term scales, nor any causal links between different temporal scales.

Full Paragraph Text: We further reinforced our business through continued active portfolio management, reviewing the performance of different products in different markets to assess strate gic fit, the extent to which they were accretive against our financial targets, and what investments were necessary to deliver growth. We made choices about where we wanted to invest, where we wanted to improve, and what we wanted to divest. Making such choices enables us to align our resourc es behind our best ideas, products and categories, to deliver sustained financial performance and help us on our journey to recognised Nutrition, Health and Wellness leadership over the short term and the long term.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Explicit mention of 'over the short term' for delivering sustained financial performance; Long-Term: Explicit mention of 'over the long term' for achieving Nutrition, Health and Wellness leadership
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Portfolio management decisions drive short-term performance to enable long-term leadership.
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly states that portfolio management choices enable alignment of resources to deliver sustained financial performance over the short term AND help achieve Nutrition, Health and Wellness leadership over the long term. This creates a clear causal progression from short-term performance outcomes to long-term strategic objectives.
gpt5: Rationale: The text states impacts occur in both the short and long term but does not explicitly claim that outcomes at one timescale cause outcomes at another.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Delivering sustained financial performance and leadership in the short term.; Long-Term: Achieving recognized leadership in Nutrition, Health, and Wellness over the long term.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how short-term strategic decisions and resource alignment are intended to support long-term leadership goals. The explicit link between short-term actions and long-term outcomes justifies the cross-scale interaction.

This establishes direct causal links from a Medium-Term strategy to both Short-Term and Long-Term outcomes.

Full Paragraph Text: We also announced new investments and research collaborations, which will enhance our ability to deliver sci ence-based solutions to improve the quality of people’s lives. A newly-announced research partnership with the EpiGen consortium will help us to better develop our understanding of the influence of nutrition and genetics at the beginning of life and continue to build our knowledge in this important area. The Nestlé Institute of Health Sciences began a collab oration on a groundbreaking project, which could one day lead to the development of made-to-measure vitamin com binations tailored to individual needs. Our company was founded almost 150 years ago on the product Henri Nestlé invented, farine lactée. It saved the life of a child. Today we continue to invest in science-based innovation to ensure we can answer current and future needs.

gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links current actions ('began', 'today we invest') to future outcomes ('one day', 'future needs'). Other statements lack clear multi-scale causality, so only Short-Term to Long-Term links are kept.

The historical context of the company's founding supports the long-term perspective but does not form a separate link.

gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Phrases like 'new investments,' 'newly-announced partnership,' and 'began a collaboration' denote immediate actions.; Medium-Term: Strategic goals such as 'enhance our ability,' 'develop our understanding,' and the ongoing 'continue to invest in science-based innovation' span multi-year periods.; Long-Term: Historical events like 'founded almost 150 years ago,' future aspirations like 'one day lead to the development,' and addressing 'future needs' indicate processes over decades.

Full Paragraph Text: It is our fundamental belief that to be successful over time we need to create value for our shareholders while at the same time creating value for society. We call this Creating Shared Value. To prosper we have to take a long-term view, framed in a robust set of principles and values that are based on respect: respect for people, respect for the environment, and respect for the world we live in. What we do and the effects of what we do are highly visible. It is our responsibility to connect with different stakeholders, to show transparency and build trust. We have therefore again in 2014 reported on our social performance and our compliance in our Nestlé in society report, and our progress towards meeting the tough targets we set ourselves.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: 2014 reporting on social performance and compliance represents annual reporting activities; Long-Term: Taking a long-term view and being successful over time represents multi-decade strategic perspective
claude4: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Long-term strategic principles drive annual reporting and compliance activities in 2014.
claude4: Rationale: The company's long-term view and fundamental principles explicitly guide their short-term reporting practices and target-setting. The 2014 report represents the operationalization of their long-term Creating Shared Value philosophy.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit causal link connects the 2014 (short-term) reporting to any stated long-term process; references to a long-term view/prosperity are not tied causally to time-bound actions.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a short-term action (2014 report) that is explicitly linked to a long-term goal (creating shared value). The report is a step towards achieving the long-term vision.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: The explicit 'long-term view' and 'successful over time' guiding the company's strategy and targets.; Short-Term: The specific annual report published in 2014.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] A long-term strategic view and responsibility explicitly drive specific short-term reporting actions.

The 'therefore' indicates a direct causal influence from the long-term strategy to the short-term operational activity. Only two scales were needed as Medium-Term was not distinctly identified.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 we held another successful Creating Shared Value forum, this time at the Nestlé Research Center in Lausanne, co-organised for the first time with a United Nations body, the UN Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD). The President of the Swiss Confederation used his address to the event to plead for water to become a self-standing goal of the future global development agenda. At the event we renewed our long-standing partnership with the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies. Since 2006 this collaboration has focused on the improvement of rural communities’ access to clean water and sanitation.

claude4: Rationale: The established collaboration since 2006 (Long-Term) directly enabled and influenced the partnership renewal that occurred at the 2014 forum (Short-Term). The long-term relationship provided the foundation for the short-term renewal action.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The 2014 forum and presidential address occurred within a single year.; Long-Term: Reference to the future global development agenda and a long-standing partnership since 2006.
gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] A 2014 event speech was used to push water as a goal in the future global development agenda.
gpt5: Rationale: A short-term address explicitly sought to influence a long-term policy agenda, forming a clear cross-scale link. Other mentions (e.g., partnership renewal) would duplicate the same scale pair without adding a new path.

The plea aimed to shape a future global development agenda, while the renewal ensured the continuation of a collaboration active since 2006. Both links demonstrate a clear causal flow from immediate actions to sustained or future long-term outcomes.

Full Paragraph Text: Currently, at the United Nations there are intense discussions about the global development goals for the period after 2015. At the same time, governments and international organ isations are increasingly reliant on the expertise, experience and resources of the private sector to help address some of the world’s most pressing problems. This offers an opportunity for global companies such as Nestlé to make a valu able contribution, in partnership with governments and civil society. We are participating actively in the policy dialogue in areas which will deeply influence our future business, such as food security, nutrition and health, water, sustainability, and human rights.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Current UN discussions about post-2015 development goals and active policy dialogue participation; Long-Term: Areas that will deeply influence future business over decades like food security, nutrition, water sustainability
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Current UN policy discussions shape long-term business influence in sustainability areas.
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly connects present policy dialogue participation with future business influence. Current discussions about post-2015 goals represent short-term activities, while the areas mentioned (food security, water, sustainability) represent long-term business considerations spanning decades.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Current UN discussions and Nestlé’s active participation in policy dialogue.; Long-Term: Stated effects that 'will deeply influence our future business.'
gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Ongoing policy dialogue is said to deeply influence Nestlé’s future business.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links present policy dialogue to future business impacts. Other mentions (e.g., post-2015 goals) lack a clear causal statement or precise duration, so they were excluded.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses ongoing discussions and partnerships without explicit causal links between different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Links: Short-Term -> Long-Term | Medium-Term -> Short-Term | Short-Term -> Long-Term
gemini2.5: Final Link: Short-Term -> Long-Term, Medium-Term -> Short-Term, Short-Term -> Long-Term
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Current intense discussions and active participation; immediate opportunities.; Medium-Term: Ongoing trend of increasing reliance by governments and organizations.; Long-Term: Global development goals for after 2015; future business influence over decades.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term, Long-Term] Current discussions and active participation, driven by increasing reliance, shape long-term global development goals and influence future business.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links current (Short-Term) discussions to long-term global development goals and active participation to future business influence. An ongoing trend of increasing reliance (Medium-Term) by governments creates immediate opportunities (Short-Term) for companies. All three scales are necessary to capture these distinct causal interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: Our success has always been based upon our determination to stay the course and look ahead, to understand the environment in which we operate, to organise ourselves to seize opportunities to deliver profitable growth, now and in the future. Although we are operating in a challenging and turbulent economic environment, we see these as fascinating times, full of opportunities. We continue to commit ourselves to ambitious financial targets. We aim to achieve organic growth of around 5% to 6%, improvements in margins and underlying earnings per share in constant currencies, as well as capital efficiency. There will be years when we exceed our ambition and years where we come close, but this is the line we want to walk over time.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Annual financial targets and yearly performance variations ('years when we exceed'); Long-Term: Future-oriented strategy and 'over time' commitment to sustained growth trajectory
claude4: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Strategic vision drives annual financial performance targets and expectations.
claude4: Rationale: The text shows how long-term strategic commitment ('over time' growth trajectory) explicitly guides short-term annual targets and yearly performance variations. The company's future-oriented approach directly influences their immediate financial ambitions and expectations.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: “now” and current organizing/commitment actions.; Long-Term: “in the future” and “over time” denote long-run outcomes.
gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Present organizing to seize opportunities is intended to deliver profitable growth in the future.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties current actions to future outcomes (“now and in the future”). No medium-term duration is specified, and other statements lack explicit cross-scale causality.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses ambitions and strategies without explicit causal links between different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Annual fluctuations in performance ('years when we exceed... come close').; Medium-Term: Multi-year 'ambitious financial targets' and 'organic growth' aims.; Long-Term: Sustained strategic commitment 'over time' for a defined path.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term, Long-Term] Annual performance is measured against medium-term targets, which collectively define the company's long-term strategic trajectory.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text establishes a clear causal chain. Short-term annual results are explicitly linked to the achievement of medium-term financial targets. These medium-term targets, in turn, are presented as the consistent 'line' the company intends to follow 'over time,' thus shaping its long-term strategy.

Full Paragraph Text: We would like to thank our 339000 employees, whose com mitment to Nestlé, hard work and disciplined alignment behind our strategy ensured that we achieved our common goals. Their talent, their creativity, their discipline and entrepreneurship are key to delivering our results. We would also like to thank you, our shareholders, for your investment and your confidence, which have enabled us to deliver good returns for investors over the long term.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Employee commitment and hard work that achieved common goals and delivered results; Long-Term: Good returns for investors delivered over the long term
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Employee performance drives long-term investor returns
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly states that employee commitment and results delivery enabled the company to deliver good returns over the long term. This creates a clear causal link from short-term operational performance to long-term financial outcomes.
gpt5: Rationale: Only 'long term' returns are mentioned; no other event has an explicit timeframe, so no cross-scale causal link can be established.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Employee commitment and hard work are immediate actions.; Long-Term: Delivering good returns for investors over the long term.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Employee efforts in the short term contribute to long-term investor returns.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links employee efforts to long-term returns for investors. Short-term actions by employees are causally connected to long-term outcomes, justifying the cross-scale link.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Employees' 'commitment, hard work' are daily/weekly efforts.; Medium-Term: 'Common goals' are multi-year strategies; 'investment and confidence' imply sustained multi-year support.; Long-Term: 'Good returns... over the long term' explicitly defines this scale.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term, Long-Term] Daily employee efforts contribute to multi-year strategic goals, and sustained shareholder support enables long-term investor returns.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links short-term employee efforts to achieving medium-term strategic goals. Separately, it connects sustained medium-term shareholder investment and confidence to delivering long-term returns. All three temporal scales are necessary to capture these distinct causal interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: For almost 150 years we have enhanced people’s lives by offer ing tastier and healthier food and beverages choices at all stages of life and at any time of day, helping them care for themselves and their families. We have built our success by anticipating the future and continuously adapting ourselves to seize the opportunities it presents.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: 150 years of enhancing people's lives through food and beverages; Short-Term: continuously adapting and seizing opportunities as they present
claude4: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Century-long success enables continuous adaptation to seize emerging opportunities.
claude4: Rationale: The 150-year track record of success explicitly enables the company's ability to continuously adapt and seize opportunities. The long-term foundation directly supports short-term adaptive capabilities.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: “At any time of day” implies within-day offerings.; Long-Term: “For almost 150 years” signals decades-long impact.
gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Daily availability of offerings is cited as the means of enhancing lives over nearly 150 years.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties daily product availability to sustained enhancement across 150 years. Other statements lack clear durations, so no additional cross-scale links are used.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph does not provide explicit causal links between events or processes at different temporal scales. It describes a general long-term strategy without specific short-term or medium-term actions linked to it.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The act of 'seizing opportunities' implies timely, responsive actions to often transient conditions, fitting a short-term timeframe.; Long-Term: Phrases like 'almost 150 years,' 'built our success,' 'anticipating the future,' and 'continuously adapting ourselves' clearly denote processes unfolding over decades.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Long-term continuous adaptation enables short-term opportunity seizing, which in turn builds long-term success.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes a long-term strategy of continuous adaptation and future anticipation. This long-term capability enables the company to perform short-term actions of seizing opportunities. These cumulative short-term actions are then explicitly stated as the mechanism by which the company has built its long-term success over 150 years.

Full Paragraph Text: Through the continuous innovation and renovation of our pro ducts we are helping people enjoy healthier diets. In 2014 we continued to invest behind the ideas, the products and the categories that help us on our journey towards recognised Nutrition, Health and Wellness leadership, and deliver sustained financial performance.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: 2014 investments in ideas, products and categories; Long-Term: journey towards recognised Nutrition, Health and Wellness leadership
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] 2014 investments drive long-term wellness leadership journey.
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly states that 2014 investments help on the journey towards long-term leadership. This creates a clear causal link from short-term actions to long-term strategic outcomes.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Specific action in 2014: continued investment.; Long-Term: A 'journey' to leadership and 'sustained financial performance' imply multi-decade aims.
gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] 2014 investments are stated to drive a long-term journey to NHW leadership and sustained financial performance.
gpt5: Rationale: The dated 2014 investment is short-term. The text explicitly ties it to a long-term journey to leadership and sustained performance. Other claims lack clear timeframes for cross-scale mapping.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph does not provide explicit causal links between events or processes at different temporal scales. It mentions ongoing innovation and investment but lacks specific timeframes or causal interactions across scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The phrase 'In 2014 we continued to invest' refers to a specific action within a single year.; Long-Term: Phrases like 'journey towards recognised Nutrition, Health and Wellness leadership' and 'deliver sustained financial performance' imply strategic goals and outcomes unfolding over decades.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Short-term investments made in 2014 are causally linked to achieving long-term strategic goals and sustained financial performance.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that 'In 2014 we continued to invest' (Short-Term) directly helps the company on its 'journey towards recognised Nutrition, Health and Wellness leadership, and deliver sustained financial performance' (Long-Term). This establishes a clear causal link from a specific annual action to multi-decade strategic outcomes. Only two scales are needed to capture this interaction.

Full Paragraph Text: The Nestlé Strategic Roadmap (facing page) is our compass, driving internal alignment behind our goals. The roadmap shows the strengths we leverage to drive performance and deliver com petitive advantage. Our strong culture, values and principles, all based on respect, unite us worldwide.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes static organizational elements (roadmap, culture, values, principles) without specifying timeframes or causal relationships between different temporal scales. No temporal processes or cross-scale interactions are mentioned.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit timeframes or causal links across different temporal scales are stated; statements are general and lack durations.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes strategic alignment and cultural values without explicit cross-scale causal interactions.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: Our strong culture, values and principles are enduring, foundational aspects persisting over decades.; Medium-Term: The Nestlé Strategic Roadmap implies a multi-year plan or strategy (1-5 years).
gemini2.5: Summary: [Long-Term, Medium-Term] Enduring company culture and values are leveraged as strengths to drive the multi-year strategic roadmap.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text indicates that 'Our strong culture, values and principles' (Long-Term) are 'strengths we leverage' for the 'Nestlé Strategic Roadmap' (Medium-Term). This demonstrates a clear causal link where a long-term, foundational aspect influences a medium-term strategic plan.

Full Paragraph Text: Our ambition is not just to be the leader but the industry refer ence for Nutrition, Health and Wellness. In recent years we have built on the strong foundations of our unrivalled food and bev erage portfolio, exploring the benefits of nutrition’s therapeutic role with Nestlé Health Science. In 2014 we again expanded the boundaries of Nutrition, Health and Wellness with the creation of Nestlé Skin Health, offering scientifically-proven products and solutions for people’s skin health needs throughout their lives.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes business expansions and strategic developments but lacks explicit causal connections between different temporal scales. While 2014 represents a specific short-term event and 'recent years' suggests medium-term activity, no clear causal relationship is established between these timeframes.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: In 2014 we ... created Nestlé Skin Health.; Long-Term: Skin health needs 'throughout their lives'.
gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] The 2014 creation of Nestlé Skin Health enables offerings aimed at people’s skin health needs throughout their lives.
gpt5: Rationale: A dated creation (2014) is a short-term action that results in offerings addressing lifelong needs, a long-term scope. Other mentions lack explicit cross-scale causality, so excluded.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes actions and ambitions without explicit causal links between different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: Refers to multi-year strategic initiatives like 'in recent years we have built' and the 'creation of Nestlé Skin Health in 2014' as a strategic transition.; Long-Term: Encompasses the overarching 'ambition' to be an industry reference and the sustained 'offering... throughout their lives'.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Long-Term] Strategic initiatives over recent years and in 2014 directly contribute to and enable the company's long-term ambition and sustained offerings.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly describes two distinct Medium-Term strategic actions: building with Nestlé Health Science and creating Nestlé Skin Health. Both actions are presented as directly influencing or enabling the company's overarching Long-Term ambition and its commitment to providing solutions throughout people's lives, establishing clear cross-scale causal links.

Full Paragraph Text: In the following pages we highlight some of our efforts to con tribute to society, driven by our determination to offer Nutrition, Health and Wellness for all.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph contains only a general statement about ongoing efforts without specifying any timeframes or causal relationships between different temporal scales.
gpt5: Rationale: The text is a generic mission statement without concrete timed actions or explicit causal links across different temporal scales.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph does not specify any events or processes with explicit temporal scales or causal interactions across different scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The act of 'highlight[ing] some of our efforts' in the 'following pages' is an immediate reporting action.; Medium-Term: 'Our efforts to contribute to society' represent ongoing programs or strategies typically unfolding over multiple years.; Long-Term: The 'determination to offer Nutrition, Health and Wellness for all' signifies a sustained, overarching goal spanning decades.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term, Long-Term] A long-term determination drives medium-term efforts, which are then highlighted in the short term.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The long-term 'determination' is explicitly stated as the causal force behind the multi-year 'efforts.' These ongoing 'efforts' are then the direct subject of the short-term 'highlighting' in the report, forming a clear causal chain across three distinct temporal scales.

Full Paragraph Text: Nutrition, Health and Wellness is a priority for the people who buy our products, for society as a whole and for us as a busi ness. As the world’s leading food and beverage company we have a responsibility to use our knowledge and our research and development capability to make a positive difference to society. We have an important role to play in not only provid ing good nutrition but in helping people understand its value.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes ongoing responsibilities and roles without specifying timeframes or causal relationships between different temporal scales. All statements refer to current, continuous activities rather than time-bound events or processes that influence each other across different time horizons.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit timeframes or cross-scale causal links are stated; claims are general (responsibility, role, positive difference) without temporal qualifiers.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses responsibilities and roles without specifying any temporal scales or explicit cross-scale causal links.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: The 'priority for society as a whole' and the goal to 'make a positive difference to society' imply processes unfolding over decades.; Medium-Term: The company's 'responsibility to use our knowledge and our research and development capability' represents a multi-year strategic commitment.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Long-Term, Medium-Term] A long-term societal priority influences the company's medium-term strategic R&D efforts, which in turn aim to create a long-term positive societal impact.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes a long-term societal priority for Nutrition, Health and Wellness. This priority necessitates the company's strategic, multi-year commitment to leverage its R&D capabilities (Medium-Term). These medium-term strategic efforts are explicitly aimed at making a long-term positive difference to society, establishing a clear causal chain across scales.

Full Paragraph Text: Start Healthy Stay Healthy is our interactive, science-based education programme designed to help parents and care givers provide nutritionally and developmentally adequate nutrition in the crucial first 1000 days of life. We support and promote breastfeeding as the best start a baby can have in life. Our educational programmes are targeted at people who are most involved in implementing good practices during this important early period in a child’s development. We help to guide parents and caregivers to raise healthier children and help healthcare professionals have a greater impact on the nutritional aspects of care of future generations.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: First 1000 days of life and early period in child's development; Long-Term: Future generations and long-term health outcomes from early nutrition
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Early nutrition education in first 1000 days aims to impact future generations' health outcomes.
claude4: Rationale: The program explicitly connects immediate early childhood nutrition interventions (first 1000 days) with long-term generational health impacts. Healthcare professionals' current actions are designed to influence future generations' nutritional care.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: Focus on the first 1000 days (~2.7 years) of a child's life.; Long-Term: Aims to affect the nutritional care of future generations.
gpt5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Long-Term] Early-period (first 1000 days) education is intended to shape practices that influence nutritional care for future generations.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly connects early-period guidance with later impacts on future generations. No separate short-term duration is specified beyond the 1000-day window, so only two scales are used.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The first 1000 days of life is a short-term period.; Long-Term: Impact on future generations implies long-term effects.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Guidance in the first 1000 days impacts future generations' nutrition and health.
4o: Rationale: The program targets the first 1000 days, a short-term period, to influence long-term health outcomes for future generations. This explicit link between early guidance and long-term impact justifies the cross-scale interaction.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: The 'crucial first 1000 days of life' explicitly defines a multi-year period (approx. 2.7 years).; Long-Term: The phrase 'future generations' clearly indicates processes unfolding over decades.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Long-Term] The program's focus on the crucial first 1000 days of life aims to have a lasting impact on the health of future generations.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links the 'crucial first 1000 days of life' (Medium-Term) to an 'impact on the nutritional aspects of care of future generations' (Long-Term). This establishes a direct causal influence from a multi-year intervention to a multi-decade outcome. No other explicit cross-scale interactions were identified.

Full Paragraph Text: We continue to reinforce our leadership in the area of chil dren’s nutrition. By the end of 2014 98% of all our products for children met the Nestlé Nutritional Foundation criteria for children. These criteria are based on nutrition science and public health dietary recommendations from bodies such as the World Health Organization and the Institute of Medicine. Our products are evaluated against these criteria using the Nestlé Nutritional Profiling System which determines their nutritional value and whether they achieve Nestlé Nutritional Foundation status.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a single achievement by end of 2014 (98% compliance) and explains the evaluation system, but contains no explicit causal relationships between different temporal scales.
gpt5: Rationale: Only one explicit time-bound event (by end of 2014) is stated; other causes (criteria, recommendations) lack explicit temporal scales, so no cross-scale causal link can be confirmed.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a specific achievement by the end of 2014, but does not explicitly link this short-term event to any medium-term or long-term processes or outcomes.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Achieving 98% product compliance by the end of 2014 represents a specific annual target.; Long-Term: Nutrition science and public health dietary recommendations are developed and evolve over decades.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Long-term nutrition science and public health recommendations directly inform short-term product compliance targets.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that the criteria for product compliance, a short-term achievement by 2014, are based on long-term nutrition science and public health recommendations. This establishes a clear causal link from the Long-Term scale to the Short-Term scale. No other explicit cross-scale interactions were found.

Full Paragraph Text: We are carrying out large-scale studies together with lead ing scientists of children’s diet and lifestyles, based on the success of the Nestlé Feeding Infants and Toddlers Study. In addition to dietary intakes and behaviours, our research explores family dynamics around diets and key lifestyle patterns of children while documenting their height and weight. We use this data to support our product reformulation, consumer communication and educational programmes, and we share the results with the wider scientific community, non-governmental organisations and others.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes ongoing research activities and their applications but lacks explicit temporal framing or causal connections between different time scales. While studies and product reformulation could span different timeframes, no explicit cross-scale causal relationships are stated in the text.
gpt5: Rationale: Causal relations are stated (research data informs reformulation and programs), but no explicit durations are given to map actions to different temporal scales; thus no cross-scale links can be asserted.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes ongoing research and data usage without explicit causal links between different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: Children's 'key lifestyle patterns' develop over decades.; Medium-Term: 'Large-scale studies' and 'research explores' imply multi-year projects (>1 year).; Short-Term: 'Product reformulation' refers to specific changes that can unfold within a year.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Long-Term, Medium-Term, Short-Term] Long-term lifestyle patterns influence medium-term studies, which then inform short-term product reformulations.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The long-term development of children's lifestyle patterns dictates the focus of the multi-year research studies. The data gathered from these medium-term studies then directly informs and supports specific, shorter-term product reformulation initiatives. This establishes a clear causal chain across three distinct temporal scales.

Full Paragraph Text: We ensure global compliance with responsible advertising and marketing standards for children, abiding by external pledges such as the EU Pledge. At the end of 2014, the Ex ecutive Board approved an updated and strengthened Nestlé Marketing Communication to Children Policy, which will come into effect in December 2015. To ensure consistent and effective implementation, detailed internal guidelines have been developed and external stakeholders are encouraged to provide feedback via our Tell us reporting mechanism. We have phased out our marketing communication in schools and reinforced our health and wellness education activities, particularly those that positively impact children’s development and support governments’ goals to increase physical activity.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Policy approval at end of 2014 and implementation in December 2015 represent events within a 1-year timeframe; Medium-Term: Phasing out marketing in schools and reinforcing education activities represent multi-year strategic transitions
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] Policy approval drives multi-year phase-out of school marketing and reinforcement of education activities.
claude4: Rationale: The Executive Board's policy approval in 2014-2015 explicitly enables the subsequent multi-year strategic changes in marketing practices and educational activities. This represents a clear causal link from short-term governance decisions to medium-term operational transformations.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Reinforced health and wellness education activities (recent actions).; Long-Term: Children’s development and governments’ goals to increase physical activity.
gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Reinforced education activities are stated to drive children’s development and support governments’ physical-activity goals.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links reinforced activities (short-term actions) to long-term outcomes for children and public goals. No medium-term durations are specified; policy approval/effective dates remain within short-term.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The updated policy will come into effect in December 2015, which is within a year.; Medium-Term: The policy aims to support governments' goals, which typically span multiple years.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] The implementation of a policy in December 2015 aims to support multi-year government goals.
4o: Rationale: The text describes a policy coming into effect in December 2015, a short-term event, which is designed to support government goals, a medium-term process. This creates a clear cross-scale interaction.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The policy approval (end of 2014) and its effective date (December 2015) are specific events within a one-year timeframe.; Medium-Term: The 'phased out' and 'reinforced' actions describe multi-year transitions and implementation strategies stemming from the policy.; Long-Term: Children's development and governments' goals for physical activity represent processes and objectives unfolding over decades.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term, Long-Term] A short-term policy approval initiated medium-term implementation strategies which, in turn, aim to achieve long-term impacts on children's development and societal goals.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details a causal chain. A specific short-term event, the approval and implementation of a new policy, directly drives medium-term actions like phasing out marketing and reinforcing education. These medium-term efforts are then stated to causally influence long-term outcomes, specifically children's development and government goals for physical activity.

Full Paragraph Text: By the end of 2014 the Nestlé Healthy Kids programme was in 73 countries, supporting initiatives which demonstrate how appropriate nutrition and exercise can improve the health of children and their communities. In addition, our own studies in four countries have shown that two thirds of children are insufficiently hydrated when they arrive at school. In 2014 we provided tools and information that schools, parents and caregivers need to ensure children learn about the benefits of healthy hydration.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes activities and findings from 2014 without establishing causal relationships between different temporal scales. All mentioned events (programme expansion, studies, tool provision) occur within the same short-term timeframe and do not explicitly influence or result from processes at other temporal scales.
gpt5: Rationale: The text lists 2014 activities and study findings but does not explicitly link them causally to multi-year or long-term outcomes; no cross-scale causal wording is present.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes short-term actions and outcomes within 2014, with no explicit causal links to medium or long-term processes.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The action of providing tools and information occurred 'In 2014', a specific event within a single year.; Long-Term: The objective 'to ensure children learn about the benefits of healthy hydration' implies sustained behavioral change and health improvements over many years.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] A short-term action of providing tools in 2014 aims to ensure long-term learning and health benefits for children.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links the 'In 2014' action of providing tools (Short-Term) to the objective of ensuring children learn about healthy hydration benefits, which is a long-term outcome. No other explicit cross-scale causal links were found. The observation of hydration issues and the provision of tools are both short-term events, and the Healthy Kids program's overall goal is long-term without a direct cross-scale influence on the specific 2014 action.

Full Paragraph Text: United for Healthier Kids is a platform, created by Nestlé in 2014, where society can engage and collaborate to find ways to improve the health and wellness of children, from conception to the age of 12 years. In Mexico, a TV series was launched which supports and encourages five families looking to change their eating and lifestyle habits over six months. The platform has also been launched in the Philippines.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Six-month family lifestyle change program in Mexico TV series; Long-Term: Platform created in 2014 targeting child health from conception to age 12
claude4: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Long-term platform enables short-term family intervention programs.
claude4: Rationale: The United for Healthier Kids platform, established as a long-term initiative in 2014, directly enables and supports the implementation of short-term interventions like the six-month family lifestyle change program in Mexico. This represents a clear causal link from long-term strategic infrastructure to short-term program delivery.
gpt5: Rationale: The text mentions a 2014 creation, a six-month TV series, and a broad goal up to age 12, but provides no explicit cross-scale causal linkage between these timeframes.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes initiatives without explicit causal links between different temporal scales. The TV series and platform launches are short-term actions without clear cross-scale interactions.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The TV series encourages habit changes over six months.; Long-Term: The platform's goal is to improve children's health from conception to 12 years.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] A short-term TV series intervention aims to influence long-term health and wellness improvements for children.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The TV series, a short-term initiative (6 months), explicitly supports changes in habits. These changes are presented as contributing to the platform's overarching long-term goal of improving children's health over a decade-plus timeframe. This establishes a clear causal link from a short-term action to a long-term outcome.

Full Paragraph Text: Through innovation and renovation we continue to make our products tastier and healthier. In line with the recommendations from public health authorities, we are reducing the amount of salt, sugar and saturated fats in our products as part of our contribution towards the fight against non-communicable diseases in society. Our reduction targets are in cluded in our public nutrition commitments (detailed in the Nestlé in society report) so our progress can be measured. We are also ensuring that whole grains are the primary ingredient in our breakfast cereals for children and teenagers.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Product reformulation activities and nutritional improvements happening now; Long-Term: Fight against non-communicable diseases in society - a decades-long public health challenge
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Current product improvements contribute to long-term disease prevention efforts.
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly states that current reformulation efforts (reducing salt, sugar, fats) are part of their contribution towards the long-term fight against non-communicable diseases. This creates a clear causal link from immediate product changes to long-term societal health outcomes.

Full Paragraph Text: In parts of the world where people find it difficult to get essential vitamins and minerals in their daily diets, we fortify foods to help them and their families stay healthy. We are on track to deliver our commitment of 200 billion servings of micronutrient fortified foods and beverages annually around the world by next year. In 2014 we continued to extend the reach of our microfortification programmes, focusing on categories for children and women of child-bearing age, such as fortified infant cereals and growing-up milks.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014, we transformed a dairy factory in Mexico into the company’s first ‘zero water’ manufacturing site in the world. Full Paragraph Text: The new technology used at the factory in Jalisco, Mexico, heats milk at low pressure to remove some of the water. The resulting steam is then condensed and treated and used to clean machines. It is then recycled and used again. The process reduces by 15% the total amount of water used by Nestlé Mexico. Work is now underway to deploy similar tech nology in five other manufacturing sites in water stressed are as around the world. It is just one of a number of water-saving initiatives we have introduced in recent years, allowing us to reduce total water withdrawal in absolute terms by almost one third in the last decade.

Full Paragraph Text: However, today, even brands that enjoy a high level of loyalty and trust need attention grabbing, engaging consumer communication to ensure they remain relevant to consumers. Full Paragraph Text: The successful roll-out of Maggi Oats Noodles demonstrated that healthy eating can be both enjoyable and tasty. Strong sales of the new product show that it is also good business. Maggi Oats Noodles meet Nestlé Nutritional Foundation criteria, which are based on public health recommendations. The consumer communication reinforces the importance for families to start the day with a well-balanced breakfast, including fruits and milk. In 2014, we continued to renovate Maggi products all around the world, reducing salt and fat and improving their nutritional benefits.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes product launches, sales performance, and ongoing renovations in 2014, but lacks explicit causal connections between different temporal scales. All events appear to occur within similar timeframes without clear cross-scale causation.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes product roll-out and renovation efforts but lacks explicit cross-scale causal links between different temporal scales.

gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Specific actions like product renovation in 2014 and ongoing consumer communication.; Medium-Term: Nestlé Nutritional Foundation criteria as a multi-year strategic framework for product development.; Long-Term: Public health recommendations and the goal of improving long-term family health habits and nutritional benefits.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term, Long-Term] Short-term actions like product renovation and communication influence long-term health outcomes, while long-term public health recommendations inform medium-term strategic criteria.

Explicit causal language such as 'based on,' 'reinforces,' and 'improving' allowed for the identification of cross-scale links. These links demonstrate how long-term recommendations shape medium-term strategies, and how short-term operational activities contribute to long-term health objectives.

Full Paragraph Text: The Maggi company began selling powdered soups in Switzerland in 1885. Julius Maggi had pioneered the production of pea and bean soups at the request of the Swiss Public Welfare Society to address the dietary deficiency of the work ing population. The advent of factory work for women meant less time to prepare food, and the soups were a convenient and nourishing alternative.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Maggi began selling powdered soups in 1885, a specific business launch event; Long-Term: The advent of factory work for women represents a decades-long industrial transformation
claude4: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Industrial transformation of women's work drove Maggi's 1885 soup product launch to meet new dietary needs.
claude4: Rationale: The long-term societal shift of women entering factory work created time constraints that directly motivated Maggi's specific 1885 product launch. This represents a clear causal link from a decades-long industrial transformation to a specific business response.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Maggi pioneered/started selling soups in 1885 (discrete actions).; Long-Term: Dietary deficiency of the working population (ongoing condition).
gpt5: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] A persistent dietary deficiency led to Maggi pioneering soup production at the welfare society’s request.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties product development to addressing an ongoing dietary deficiency, creating a Long-Term to Short-Term link. Other mentions (e.g., factory work for women) were not used for an additional explicit cross-scale link.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes historical events without explicit cross-scale causal interactions between different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: The 'advent of factory work for women' and 'dietary deficiency of the working population' represent societal shifts and persistent issues unfolding over decades.; Short-Term: 'Less time to prepare food' describes a daily impact, and 'pioneered the production of pea and bean soups' refers to a specific event and its immediate solution.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Long-term societal changes like women entering factory work and persistent dietary deficiencies directly influenced short-term daily routines and the development of convenient food solutions.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The advent of factory work for women (Long-Term) directly caused less time for food preparation (Short-Term). Separately, the long-term dietary deficiency of the working population prompted the short-term pioneering of convenient soups. These represent two distinct causal pathways from long-term societal conditions to short-term daily impacts and solutions.

Full Paragraph Text: Parents want their children to make the most of their potential. Nestlé Milo, which is mainly consumed by children aged 7–12, can help to provide the nourishing energy they need to succeed. Activ-Go plays a role in energy release, muscle function, bone maintenance and red blood cell formation, all essential for physical activity.

Full Paragraph Text: Nestlé Milo celebrated its 80th birthday in 2014. It was created by Nestlé engineer Thomas Mayne to help children who had poor diets get sufficient nutrition. Full Paragraph Text: The Group’s trading operating profit was CHF 14.0 billion, representing a margin of 15.3%, up 10 basis points, and up 30 basis points in constant currencies. Distribution costs were up by 10 basis points. Total marketing and administration expenses rose by 10 basis points as we increased consumer facing marketing support for our brands.

Full Paragraph Text: Our performance in North America was affected by the frozen category. Projects are underway to reposition Lean Cuisine, Hot Pockets and Stouffers. They address all elements of the marketing mix, reflecting trends such as organic and ethnic, enhancing the brands’ relevance to consumers. We are taking the same approach in frozen pizza where our California Pizza Kitchen did well. In ice cream the super premium segment performed well with Gelato, and snacks returned to growth, although the premium segment was subdued. In confectionery the successful roll-out of Butterfinger Peanut Butter Cups continued. Innovations like Natural Bliss and seasonal renovations of flavours helped Coffee-mate de liver good growth. Innovation also ensured the petcare busi ness in North America continued to grow with Dog Chow, Pro Plan and Tidy Cats Lightweight cat litter as highlights. The launch of Beyond natural pet food gained momentum.

Nescafé Dolce Gusto delivered double-digit growth across the region, while Dog Chow and Pro Plan drove sales in the petcare business.

Full Paragraph Text: The slower growth in the Zone was due to our largest market China and to Oceania. In China we needed to adapt our portfolio to reconnect with the fast-changing expectations of the Chinese consumer. Therefore, in addition to correcting trade stocks throughout the year, we focused on innovation, on reformulation and on re-launches, particularly in coffee, ready-to-drink and confectionery. We continued to see good performances in ambient culinary, ice cream and ready-to drink coffee. In Oceania we are focused on developing new trade channels.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: correcting trade stocks throughout the year; Medium-Term: adapting portfolio to reconnect with fast-changing consumer expectations
claude4: Summary: [Medium-Term, Short-Term] Strategic portfolio adaptation drove immediate operational adjustments in trade stocks.
claude4: Rationale: The multi-year strategic need to adapt the portfolio to changing consumer expectations explicitly caused the company to focus on correcting trade stocks throughout the year. This represents a clear causal link from medium-term strategy to short-term operational actions.

It was also rolled out in Africa, helping to deliver good growth across the continent.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 Unilever launched a newly developed packaging technology for Dove Body Wash bottles that uses 15% less plastic. Projected cost savings for the whole portfolio are €50 million. This is another substantial step towards the USLP target of halving Unilever’s waste footprint by 2020.

Full Paragraph Text: The MuCell® Technology for Extrusion Blow Moulding was created in partnership with two packaging suppliers – ALPLA and MuCell Extrusion. By using gas-injection to create gas bubbles in the middle layer of the bottle wall, it reduces the density of the bottle and the amount of plastic required.

Full Paragraph Text: The technology represents a breakthrough for Unilever and the industry. A full roll-out across every Unilever product and packaging format could save up to 27,000 tonnes of plastic per year.

Full Paragraph Text: However, Unilever’s business model and strategy proved robust, delivering a competitive performance with underlying sales growth ahead of the market and solid margin expansion. Our growth model is based on a leaner, more agile Unilever and consistency of delivery in this more volatile market is key. The Boards remain convinced that a clear, purpose-driven business model is the best way for Unilever to continue generating sustainable, long-term returns for all stakeholders, including our shareholders, as proved by a year of strong, dependable cash flow and steadily increasing dividends. The full year dividend paid in 2014 rose to €1.12, a 7% increase on 2013.
