Full Paragraph Text: We took steps last year to sharpen the portfolio even further with a number of strategic acquisitions and disposal of non-core brands, although there is always scope to do more and I would like to see the level of activity accelerate in the year ahead. It is also clear that we still need to do more to get our Foods category growing again, although we are winning market share.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Steps taken 'last year' and desired acceleration 'in the year ahead'; Medium-Term: Strategic acquisitions and disposals for portfolio sharpening represent multi-year strategic transitions
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] Last year's actions support multi-year strategic portfolio transformation.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly connects last year's specific actions (acquisitions/disposals) to the broader strategic goal of portfolio sharpening, which represents a multi-year transformation process. The desired acceleration 'in the year ahead' reinforces this short-term to medium-term progression.
gpt5: Rationale: Only short-term actions ('last year', 'year ahead') are explicit, and no causal link to a different time scale is stated. The Foods growth aim lacks an explicit timeframe.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses short-term actions and intentions without explicit causal links to medium or long-term processes.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: Strategic acquisitions and disposals for portfolio sharpening are multi-year strategic initiatives.; Short-Term: The phrase 'in the year ahead' explicitly indicates a timeframe of days to 1 year.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Short-Term] Strategic portfolio adjustments made last year influence the desired acceleration of activity in the upcoming year.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links the 'steps last year to sharpen the portfolio' (Medium-Term, as strategic acquisitions/disposals are multi-year efforts) to the desire for 'accelerated activity in the year ahead' (Short-Term). The phrase 'although there is always scope to do more' acts as the causal bridge, indicating that the Medium-Term actions revealed the need for further, more intense Short-Term efforts. No other explicit cross-scale causal links were found.

Full Paragraph Text: This is a tough business to be in – with much of our portfolio in flat or even declining developed markets – but we have to do more to leverage the strength of our wonderful Foods brands and bring back the growth momentum. By contrast, while our Home Care and Refreshment categories delivered good or solid growth, we need to increase the levels of cash and profitability if we are to invest in the many growth opportunities. These will all be priorities in 2015.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: 2015 priorities and current quarterly/annual performance metrics; Medium-Term: Multi-year strategy to leverage brands and bring back growth momentum
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] 2015 priorities target multi-year growth momentum recovery through brand leverage and investment strategies.
claude4: Rationale: The text shows 2015 priorities (Short-Term) explicitly designed to address multi-year challenges like bringing back growth momentum and leveraging brand strength (Medium-Term). The causal link is clear: immediate actions are planned to achieve longer-term strategic outcomes.
gpt5: Rationale: Only explicit timeframe is 2015 (short-term priorities). The causal statement about investing lacks an explicit multi-year or long-term duration, so no cross-scale link can be confirmed.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses short-term priorities for 2015 but does not explicitly link these to any medium- or long-term processes or outcomes.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: Refers to 'flat or even declining developed markets', implying a sustained condition over decades.; Short-Term: Explicitly stated 'priorities in 2015' for increasing cash/profitability and bringing back growth.; Medium-Term: Refers to 'invest in the many growth opportunities', suggesting multi-year strategic investments.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term, Medium-Term] Long-term market conditions drive short-term priorities, which in turn enable medium-term growth investments.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The long-term trend of declining markets explicitly frames the need for short-term priorities in 2015 to regain growth. Furthermore, these short-term efforts to increase cash and profitability are presented as a direct prerequisite for investing in medium-term growth opportunities. This establishes a clear causal chain across all three scales.

Full Paragraph Text: Meeting the diverse interests of multiple stakeholders is a challenge for a company of Unilever’s size but also a great opportunity given our Vision to grow in a sustainable and socially inclusive way. Once again, we made good progress.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses stakeholder management challenges and sustainable growth vision but provides no explicit temporal information or causal relationships between different time scales. The phrase 'made good progress' lacks specific timeframe context.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit timeframes or causal links across different temporal scales are stated; the text is high-level and generic.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph does not provide explicit causal links between events or processes at different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: The 'Vision to grow in a sustainable and socially inclusive way' represents a strategic objective spanning decades.; Short-Term: 'Once again, we made good progress' refers to recent achievements, typically within a year.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] A company's long-term vision for sustainable growth directly influences and guides its short-term progress and achievements.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The 'Vision to grow in a sustainable and socially inclusive way' is a clear Long-Term strategic goal. The statement 'Once again, we made good progress' indicates Short-Term achievements. The phrasing 'given our Vision... we made good progress' explicitly links the long-term vision as the context and driver for the short-term progress, establishing a causal influence from the Long-Term scale to the Short-Term scale.

Full Paragraph Text: There is no doubt that over the long term our investors have benefited from their continued belief in Unilever, with total shareholder return increasing by a further 18% in 2014. Our employees remain a key priority of course and, despite the constrained economic environment, we did not compromise on our investments in training, personal development, safety and other employee support programmes. It was heartening to see employee engagement scores remain at historically high levels in our annual Global People Survey (GPS), with improvements across all five metrics.
claude4: Rationale: While the paragraph mentions long-term investor benefits and short-term 2014 returns, these are presented as parallel outcomes rather than causally linked processes. The employee investments and engagement scores are also described as concurrent activities without explicit causal connections across temporal scales.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: TSR increased by 18% in 2014 (single year).; Long-Term: Investors benefited “over the long term”.
gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] A single-year TSR gain in 2014 is cited as contributing to investors’ long-term benefits.
gpt5: Rationale: The sentence ties a one-year TSR rise to the broader long-term benefit using “with,” implying additive contribution. Other elements (training, engagement scores) lack explicit cross-scale causality.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses long-term benefits to investors and short-term employee engagement scores, but no explicit causal link between different temporal scales is provided.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The '18% in 2014' refers to a specific annual return.; Long-Term: The phrase 'over the long term' explicitly defines this scale for investor benefits.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] A short-term increase in shareholder return contributed to the long-term benefits for investors.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links the 18% increase in total shareholder return in 2014 (Short-Term) to the overall 'long term' benefit for investors. This indicates a causal influence where a specific short-term outcome contributes to a broader long-term trend. No other cross-scale interactions were identified, as employee-related events were all within the Short-Term scale.

Full Paragraph Text: It is also clear that the demand to join Unilever has never been greater. We received over 2 million applications or expressions of interest in 2014 and for the second year running Unilever was ranked the third most in-demand employer among jobseekers on LinkedIn, behind only Apple and Google, as more and more young people want to work for purpose-driven organisations.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes concurrent events in 2014 (applications received, LinkedIn ranking) and a general trend of young people seeking purpose-driven organizations, but lacks explicit causal connections between different temporal scales. All mentioned elements appear to be describing the same short-term period or general patterns without clear cross-scale causation.

gpt5: Summary: [Long-Term, Medium-Term] Rising youth preference for purpose-driven work drives Unilever’s two-year “most in-demand” LinkedIn ranking.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links the youth trend to the two-year ranking via “as”. The 2014 application count is short-term but not explicitly causally tied, so it is excluded.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a short-term event (2014 applications) and a general trend (demand for purpose-driven work) but lacks explicit cross-scale causal links.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term, Long-Term] A long-term shift in young people's values drives Unilever's medium-term employer ranking, which in turn boosts short-term application numbers.

This strong employer brand then directly leads to the high volume of applications received in a specific year (short-term), forming a clear causal chain across scales.

Full Paragraph Text: We also made progress in our commitment to serve a wider group of stakeholders through the USLP and our Vision of growing the business while reducing our environmental footprint and increasing our positive social impact, not only in that part of the business under our direct control but throughout the whole value chain. This manifests itself in many different ways – everything from playing our part in putting an end to deforestation to ensuring we embrace and advance human rights principles throughout the length of our supply chain. You can see a number of examples set out in other parts of this report.

While it mentions long-term goals like ending deforestation, there are no explicit cross-scale causal interactions described.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses broad commitments and goals without specifying concrete events or timeframes that map to distinct temporal scales, thus no cross-scale link exists.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A

All these elements fall under the 'Long-Term' scale. There are no explicit causal links or interactions identified between different temporal scales (Short-Term, Medium-Term, or Long-Term) within the provided text.

Full Paragraph Text: It was pleasing to see our efforts recognised once again in 2014, including regaining sector leadership in the prestigious Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI) and being ranked – for the fourth year running – as the Number One Company in the Globescan/SustainAbility index of leading sustainability experts around the world.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes recognition events in 2014 and a four-year ranking pattern, but contains no causal relationships between different temporal scales - only reporting of achievements and awards within similar timeframes.

gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] The 2014 ranking yielded a four-year running No.1 streak.
gpt5: Rationale: 2014 recognition is short-term. “Fourth year running” is a multi-year status. The text ties them: the 2014 ranking confirms and extends the streak, so Short-Term influences Medium-Term.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes achievements in 2014 and rankings over four years, but lacks explicit causal links between different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: The phrase 'for the fourth year running' explicitly indicates a sustained process over multiple years (4 years).; Short-Term: The recognition and specific rankings occurred in the year 2014, an event within a 1-year timeframe.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Short-Term] Sustained multi-year performance directly resulted in specific annual recognition and rankings.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links a Medium-Term sustained performance ('for the fourth year running') to a Short-Term outcome (the ranking received in 2014). This demonstrates a clear causal influence from a multi-year process to a single-year event, establishing a cross-scale interaction.

Full Paragraph Text: A fundamental requirement at Unilever is to understand our consumers. We use focus groups and quantitative studies and spend time with consumers in stores and in their homes to find out what is important to them – as citizens as well as consumers – so we can create products they need and want. Unilever carelines are also a rich source of information. Digital communications and social media mean we can engage with large numbers of people consistently over long periods of time so we can immerse ourselves in their day-to-day lives. We can use online search data to identify and anticipate future consumer trends and gain a competitive edge.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Day-to-day consumer lives and immediate engagement activities; Long-Term: Consistent engagement over long periods of time and anticipating future consumer trends
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Daily consumer engagement builds long-term insights for future trend anticipation.
claude4: Rationale: The text shows how short-term daily consumer interactions through digital communications feed into long-term strategic capabilities for trend identification and competitive advantage. The causal link is explicit in how day-to-day engagement enables long-period consistency and future anticipation.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: “engage with large numbers of people consistently over long periods of time.”; Short-Term: “immerse ourselves in their day-to-day lives.”
gpt5: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Prolonged digital engagement enables immersion in consumers’ day-to-day lives.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links long-term engagement to short-term daily-life immersion via “so we can.” No other explicit cross-scale causal links are stated.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Engaging with consumers through focus groups and social media.; Long-Term: Using digital communications to engage consistently over long periods.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Short-term consumer engagement through digital means leads to long-term immersion in consumer lives.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how short-term activities like focus groups and social media engagement allow Unilever to maintain long-term consumer relationships. This interaction is explicit in the text, as short-term actions are used to achieve long-term goals.
gemini2.5: Links: Long-Term -> Short-Term | Short-Term -> Medium-Term | Short-Term -> Long-Term
gemini2.5: Final Link: Long-Term -> Short-Term, Short-Term -> Medium-Term, Short-Term -> Long-Term
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Refers to 'day-to-day lives' and the immediate analysis of 'online search data'.; Medium-Term: Refers to 'future consumer trends' which represent multi-year transitions.; Long-Term: Refers to 'consistently over long periods of time' for engagement and 'gain a competitive edge' as a strategic outcome.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term, Long-Term] Long-term digital engagement enables short-term consumer immersion; short-term data analysis anticipates medium-term trends and secures long-term competitive advantage.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details how long-term digital engagement facilitates short-term understanding of daily consumer lives. Additionally, short-term analysis of online search data is shown to influence both medium-term anticipation of consumer trends and the achievement of a long-term competitive edge. All three temporal scales are necessary to capture these distinct, explicit causal interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: R&D is an engine of sustainable growth; Unilever spends around €1 billion on R&D annually. Our 6,000 R&D professionals are responsible for building brands through benefit-led innovation, which is unlocked through science and technology. This includes looking at long-term emerging science and transforming science into technologies which are used to design branded products.

claude4: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Long-term science research drives current product development and annual R&D investments.

Full Paragraph Text: The big development for 2014 has been the launch of our Partner To Win 2020 programme to create a supplier ecosystem where partners work with us and each other to create breakthroughs in products or packaging to deliver the capacity, innovation and sustainable solutions to meet our growth ambition. A great example is the new Dove Body Wash bottle using 15% less plastic (see inside front cover).

Full Paragraph Text: That knowledge helps us to target our subsequent R&D activities and our investments in innovation. Unilever has filed more than 200 new patent applications in 2014 and our Partner To Win 2020 programme, also launched in 2014, creates a new platform for us to work with our suppliers in the development of product and packaging innovations that capture consumers’ interest and attention.

Full Paragraph Text: Unilever itself manufactures the majority of its products and we maintain an international network of 240 manufacturing sites. In sourcing large amounts of raw materials we also have a direct impact on the environment. By sourcing sustainably, we can protect scarce resources, ensure security of supply for our business and reduce price volatility while protecting the environment and enhancing people’s lives, which is at the heart of our Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (USLP). More detail can be found on page 11.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Price volatility reduction represents immediate market fluctuations and supply chain impacts; Long-Term: Protecting scarce resources and the Unilever Sustainable Living Plan represent long-term sustainability strategies
claude4: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Sustainable sourcing protects resources while reducing immediate price volatility.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph shows how Unilever's long-term sustainable sourcing strategy directly addresses short-term price volatility. The USLP represents a long-term approach that yields immediate supply chain benefits.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit timeframes or cross-scale causal chains are stated. Benefits (e.g., reduced price volatility, security of supply) are listed as co-effects of sustainable sourcing without temporal qualifiers.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses sustainable sourcing and its benefits but does not explicitly link events or processes across different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: The strategic practice of 'sourcing sustainably' and the 'Unilever Sustainable Living Plan' are multi-year strategies.; Long-Term: 'Protect scarce resources' and 'protecting the environment and enhancing people’s lives' are processes unfolding over decades.

gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links the medium-term strategic practice of 'sourcing sustainably' to two distinct long-term outcomes: 'protect scarce resources' and 'protecting the environment and enhancing people’s lives'. These are direct causal influences across different temporal scales, as defined by the provided scale descriptions. No short-term interactions or chained dependencies were identified.

Full Paragraph Text: By the time manufacturing is under way Unilever’s marketing teams have worked with our category experts to define the complete marketing mix, including communications, that makes our brands come alive. Communicating the benefits of our products and brands to consumers is increasingly complex, with digital communications and social media creating new and more direct ways to engage alongside traditional media.

This indicates a causal influence where the evolving communication landscape dictates the approach for immediate marketing efforts. Only two scales are needed to capture this direct interaction.

Full Paragraph Text: Our logistics operations move Unilever products to retailers and our go-to-market teams ensure that we get enough of the right products in the right price bracket in the right sales channels for consumers to buy, be they stores or the fast-growing e-commerce channel.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes ongoing operational activities (logistics, go-to-market) without specifying timeframes or causal relationships between different temporal scales. All activities appear to be routine business operations without explicit temporal distinctions or cross-scale interactions.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit timeframes or cross-scale causality are stated; 'fast-growing' lacks a defined duration and no causal link across scales is described.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes logistics and market operations without explicit cross-scale temporal interactions. No causal links between different temporal scales are evident.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The 'logistics operations' and 'go-to-market teams ensure' describe daily/weekly operational activities.; Medium-Term: The 'fast-growing e-commerce channel' implies a multi-year trend of market development and growth.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Short-Term] The multi-year growth of the e-commerce channel influences short-term logistics and go-to-market strategies.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes how short-term logistics and go-to-market operations are conducted for various sales channels, including the 'fast-growing e-commerce channel'. The 'fast-growing' nature of e-commerce represents a medium-term trend, which directly shapes the short-term operational decisions and strategies of the go-to-market teams. This establishes a clear causal link where a medium-term development influences short-term actions.

Full Paragraph Text: We make the majority of what we sell through a network of more than 240 manufacturing sites around the world. We have invested significantly in our factories in recent years to create an efficient, reliable and more sustainable network. We are now able to maximise the global scale of our operations, while having the agility to meet local demands. More eco-efficient production is helping us meet the USLP targets, so by the end of January 2015, for instance, all our factories had achieved zero non-hazardous waste to landfill, producing 140,000 tonnes less waste. Since 2008, we estimate that eco-production has avoided costs in excess of €400 million.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Zero waste achievement by end of January 2015 represents a specific annual milestone; Long-Term: Investments in recent years and cost avoidance since 2008 represent multi-year processes spanning decades
claude4: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Multi-year sustainability investments enabled specific 2015 zero waste achievement milestone.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph shows how long-term investments in eco-efficient production (spanning years since 2008) directly enabled the achievement of specific short-term targets like the January 2015 zero waste milestone. This represents a clear causal flow from sustained long-term efforts to concrete short-term outcomes.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: “Invested significantly… in recent years.”; Short-Term: “We are now able to maximise… and meet local demands.”
gpt5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Short-Term] Recent multi-year factory investments enabled current capability to maximize operations and meet local demand.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links recent multi-year investments to present operational agility. Other timeframes (e.g., since 2008) lack an explicit cross-scale causal tie to a different-scale event.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: By the end of January 2015, all factories achieved zero non-hazardous waste to landfill.; Medium-Term: Investments in factories in recent years to create a sustainable network.; Long-Term: Since 2008, eco-production has avoided costs in excess of €400 million.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term, Long-Term] Investments in recent years led to short-term waste reduction and long-term cost savings.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how medium-term investments in factory efficiency led to short-term achievements in waste reduction and long-term cost savings. The explicit causal links between these scales are clear in the text.
gemini2.5: Links: Medium-Term -> Short-Term | Medium-Term -> Long-Term | Short-Term -> Medium-Term
gemini2.5: Final Link: Medium-Term -> Short-Term, Medium-Term -> Long-Term, Short-Term -> Medium-Term
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Achievement of zero non-hazardous waste to landfill by a specific date (January 2015) falls within a 1-year timeframe.; Medium-Term: Investments made 'in recent years' and 'USLP targets' represent multi-year strategies or transitions.; Long-Term: Avoided costs 'Since 2008' indicates a cumulative benefit over a period exceeding 5 years.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term, Long-Term] Medium-term investments drove short-term waste reduction and long-term cost savings, with short-term achievements contributing to medium-term sustainability goals.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details how multi-year investments (Medium-Term) enabled eco-efficient production. This production directly resulted in a specific short-term achievement (zero waste by Jan 2015) and cumulative long-term financial benefits (avoided costs since 2008). Furthermore, the short-term waste achievement is presented as contributing to the broader multi-year sustainability targets (Medium-Term), establishing a clear feedback loop.

Full Paragraph Text: How we move products from factories to customers is the role of our logistics operation. We are now rolling out our global network of logistics centres that organise movement of goods centrally and more efficiently, delivering savings, reduced stocks, reduced carbon emissions and improved customer service. These operational hubs now allow us to centralise other services too, including monitoring orders from customers through to payment.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Rolling out global network of logistics centres is an ongoing implementation process; Long-Term: Reduced carbon emissions represent sustained environmental benefits over extended periods
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Logistics network rollout drives sustained carbon emission reductions.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that rolling out the global logistics network delivers reduced carbon emissions. The network implementation is a current operational initiative (short-term), while carbon emission reductions represent sustained environmental benefits (long-term).
gpt5: Rationale: Only a current rollout with immediate operational effects is described; no explicit multi-year or long-term timelines or causal links across scales are stated.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes logistics improvements but lacks explicit cross-scale causal links between different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: The 'rolling out' of a global network implies a multi-year strategic transition.; Short-Term: The 'delivering savings, reduced stocks, improved customer service' and 'centralise other services' are immediate operational benefits and capabilities once the hubs are active.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Short-Term] The multi-year rollout of logistics centers directly enables immediate operational efficiencies and new centralized services.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly describes a Medium-Term strategic initiative ('rolling out our global network of logistics centres') that causally influences Short-Term operational outcomes ('delivering savings, reduced stocks, reduced carbon emissions and improved customer service' and 'allow us to centralise other services'). This demonstrates a clear cross-scale interaction from a multi-year project to immediate benefits.

Full Paragraph Text: We work closely with retailers to win in the market place and make sure that our brands are always available, properly displayed and in the right price bracket. Our go-to-market capability ensures that we become the supplier of choice for our customers and trade partners, through strong joint business planning and in-store execution via Perfect Store programmes, to help deliver sustainable sales growth. This is essential for us to be able to add premium brand extensions to our product ranges, land product innovations on the shelves, enter new geographies and markets, and build our distribution strength to reach new consumers.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Joint business planning, in-store execution via Perfect Store programmes, landing product innovations on shelves; Long-Term: Sustainable sales growth, building distribution strength, entering new geographies and markets
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Short-term execution activities drive long-term sustainable growth and market expansion.
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly states that short-term activities like joint business planning and Perfect Store programmes 'help deliver sustainable sales growth' and enable long-term strategic goals like entering new markets and building distribution strength.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: In-store execution via Perfect Store programmes; ensuring availability/display/price.; Long-Term: Aim to deliver sustainable sales growth.
gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] In-store execution via Perfect Store programmes helps deliver sustainable sales growth.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links near-term in-store execution to sustainable sales growth, a long-term outcome. Other items lack explicit timeframes, so only this cross-scale causal link is retained.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: In-store execution and Perfect Store programmes are short-term actions.; Long-Term: Building distribution strength and entering new markets are long-term goals.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Short-term in-store execution aids long-term market expansion and distribution goals.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes how short-term actions like in-store execution contribute to long-term objectives such as entering new markets and building distribution strength. This establishes a clear causal link between the scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Refers to specific operational activities like 'in-store execution via Perfect Store programmes' and event-based actions such as 'land product innovations on the shelves'.; Medium-Term: Encompasses multi-year strategic objectives like 'deliver sustainable sales growth' and 'become the supplier of choice' through 'joint business planning'.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] Short-term in-store execution drives medium-term sustainable sales growth, which in turn enables short-term product innovations.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links 'in-store execution via Perfect Store programmes' (Short-Term) to 'sustainable sales growth' (Medium-Term). Subsequently, this 'sustainable sales growth' (Medium-Term) is stated as essential for 'land[ing] product innovations on the shelves' (Short-Term). These form two distinct, explicit cross-scale causal links.

Full Paragraph Text: We spend about €7 billion annually on marketing, making us one of the world’s biggest advertisers. This ensures that our brands and products are consumers’ first choice. We use multiple media to achieve cut-through in a highly competitive and busy world. Traditional media channels continue to play a big part but digital communications have revolutionised the way marketing engages with people, creating entirely new sales and marketing opportunities. We create our own entertainment content, including Unilever brand advertising, and this is distributed, for example, by mobile devices in emerging markets.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes current marketing practices and ongoing digital transformation but lacks explicit causal connections between different temporal scales. The €7 billion annual spending and digital revolution are presented as current states rather than processes that causally influence different timeframes.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: “digital communications have revolutionised the way marketing engages with people” implies a multi-year structural change.; Short-Term: “creating entirely new sales and marketing opportunities” suggests immediate, actionable opportunities.
gpt5: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] A long-run digital communications revolution creates immediate sales and marketing opportunities.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links a prolonged digital shift (“have revolutionised”) to the creation of new, immediate opportunities. Other statements lack explicit multi-scale timing or causal wording, so they were excluded.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes marketing strategies and media use without explicit cross-scale causal links between different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Annual spending of €7 billion on marketing, a recurring yearly activity.; Long-Term: Ensuring brands are consumers' first choice, representing a sustained market position and strategic outcome.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Annual marketing spend directly ensures the long-term goal of brands being consumers' first choice.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The annual €7 billion marketing spend (Short-Term) is explicitly stated to 'ensure' brands are consumers' first choice (Long-Term). This direct causal link establishes a clear cross-scale interaction. No other explicit cross-scale relationships were identified in the text.

Full Paragraph Text: Unilever’s portfolio has four categories: Personal Care, Foods, Refreshment and Home Care. We have 13 brands with sales of more than €1 billion. Brands are our biggest asset but also present a risk if they do not maintain value and relevance to consumers. That’s why innovation and remaining competitive are crucial. We launched new brands in 2014, backed by marketing and customer insight, for example Regenerate, a dental care product. In addition to the Qinyuan and Talenti Gelato & Sorbetto acquisitions, we are also in the process of acquiring the Camay and Zest brands, to expand categories and boost growth. To sharpen our portfolio in 2014 we disposed of Slim. Fast, Ragu and Bertolli in North America, and other non-core Foods brands.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes various business activities in 2014 (brand launches, acquisitions, disposals) but lacks explicit causal connections between different temporal scales. All mentioned activities appear to be short-term operational decisions without clear links to medium or long-term strategic outcomes.
gpt5: Rationale: Only 2014 actions are time-stamped; outcomes like growth or competitiveness lack explicit multi-year or long-term horizons. No stated causal link across different temporal scales.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes actions and events primarily within a short-term timeframe (e.g., brand launches and acquisitions in 2014) without explicit causal links to medium or long-term processes.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Specific events in 2014 (brand launches, disposals) and ongoing acquisitions.; Medium-Term: Multi-year strategies like innovation, competitiveness, and growth.; Long-Term: Maintaining brand value and relevance over decades.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term, Long-Term] The long-term need for brand relevance drives medium-term strategies, which are supported by short-term actions for growth.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links the long-term risk of losing brand relevance to the crucial medium-term strategy of innovation. Additionally, short-term acquisitions are stated as a means to achieve medium-term category expansion and growth. All three scales are necessary to capture these distinct causal interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: Unilever’s products sell in more than 190 countries and are used by 2 billion consumers every day. Our business is organised across three geographies: the Americas; Europe; and markets comprising Asia, Australasia, Africa, Middle East, Turkey, Russia, Ukraine and Belarus. We also analyse operations by developed and emerging markets. This wide spread exposes us to economic and political risks beyond our control. However, the diversity of our portfolio and geographic reach help mitigate our exposure to any specific risk.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's current geographic structure and risk exposure without establishing any causal relationships between different temporal scales. All statements refer to present organizational facts rather than temporal processes or their interactions.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit cross-scale causal link is stated. Only “every day” provides a timeframe; other elements lack durations and no causal bridge between different temporal scales is made.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's global operations and risk management strategy but does not explicitly link events or processes across different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes ongoing business operations, organizational structure, and inherent risks/mitigations. It does not contain any explicit causal links where an event or process at one defined temporal scale influences or is influenced by another distinct temporal scale.

Full Paragraph Text: We cannot achieve our Vision to double our size unless we find new ways to operate that decouple growth from our environmental impact, while using growth as an enabler for positive social impact. Launched in 2010, the Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (USLP) is our blueprint for sustainable growth. It is helping to drive profitable growth for our brands, save costs and fuel innovation.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: USLP launched in 2010 and is currently driving profitable growth, saving costs, and fueling innovation; Long-Term: Vision to double company size represents a long-term strategic goal
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Current sustainable operations blueprint enables long-term growth vision achievement.
claude4: Rationale: The USLP serves as a current operational framework that explicitly enables the long-term vision of doubling company size. The text directly states this causal relationship through 'blueprint for sustainable growth' supporting the Vision achievement.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: Finding new ways to operate (decoupling growth from impact) implies a multi-year transition.; Long-Term: Vision to double our size and positive social impact are long-term outcomes.
gpt5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Long-Term] Multi-year operational changes are required to achieve the long-term vision to double size and deliver positive social impact.
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links achieving a long-term vision to adopting new operating methods, a multi-year shift. Other effects (profits, cost savings) lack clear cross-scale causality in the text.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The USLP is currently driving profitable growth and innovation.; Long-Term: The USLP was launched in 2010 and is a blueprint for sustainable growth over time.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] The USLP, launched in 2010, is a long-term plan that currently drives short-term growth and innovation.
4o: Rationale: The USLP, a long-term initiative, is explicitly stated to drive current short-term outcomes like growth and innovation. No medium-term scale is explicitly mentioned.
gemini2.5: Links: Long-Term -> Short-Term | Long-Term -> Short-Term | Long-Term -> Medium-Term
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: The Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (USLP) is a blueprint for sustainable growth, launched in 2010, implying a strategy over decades.; Short-Term: The USLP helps drive profitable growth and save costs, which are effects measurable within a year.; Medium-Term: The USLP helps fuel innovation, a process typically unfolding over multiple years (1-5 years).
gemini2.5: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term, Medium-Term] The Long-Term Unilever Sustainable Living Plan drives Short-Term profitable growth and cost savings, and fuels Medium-Term innovation.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (USLP), a long-term strategic blueprint, explicitly states it is 'helping to drive profitable growth for our brands, save costs and fuel innovation.' Profitable growth and cost savings are short-term outcomes, while fueling innovation is a medium-term process. This establishes clear causal links from a long-term strategy to both short-term and medium-term effects.

Full Paragraph Text: The USLP sets out three big, ambitious goals. Underpinning these goals are nine commitments supported by targets spanning our social and environmental performance.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes static organizational structure (goals, commitments, targets) without specifying timeframes or causal relationships between different temporal scales. No temporal processes or cross-scale interactions are mentioned.
gpt5: Rationale: No explicit timeframes or causal links across different temporal scales are stated; goals, commitments, and targets are mentioned without durations or cross-scale effects.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph does not provide explicit causal links between events or processes at different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: Nine commitments and targets spanning performance imply multi-year strategies.; Long-Term: Three big, ambitious goals represent long-term strategic aspirations over decades.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Long-Term] Medium-term commitments and targets are explicitly stated as underpinning long-term strategic goals.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that nine commitments and targets, which are multi-year strategies (Medium-Term), underpin the three big, ambitious goals, which are long-term aspirations (Long-Term). This establishes a clear causal link between these two distinct temporal scales.

Full Paragraph Text: We are making good progress with our first goal: to help more than a billion people improve their health and well-being by 2020, reaching 397 million by the end of 2014. The progress on our second goal is more mixed. We have achieved zero non-hazardous waste to landfill from our factories, and continue to make significant reductions in the greenhouse gas (GHG) and water impacts of our manufacturing. But the consumer element of our target to halve the water and GHG impacts of our products remains a challenge. On waste reduction, new technology such as the roll-out of compressed deodorant sprays and our new Dove Body Wash bottles has enabled reductions. On our third goal, we are also making good progress. We are now sourcing more than half our agricultural raw materials sustainably and have reached around 800,000 smallholder farmers with help and training. We have created 70,000 women micro-entrepreneurs distributing our products in India while making progress on our new commitments to enhance livelihoods across the value chain.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Progress reported by end of 2014 and current achievements; Medium-Term: Goal to help more than a billion people by 2020
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] Current achievements build toward 2020 health goal.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph shows how short-term progress (397 million reached by 2014) explicitly contributes to the medium-term target (billion people by 2020). Other achievements are reported as current status without clear temporal progression to future goals.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Reached 397 million by end of 2014 (a near-term milestone).; Long-Term: Goal to help over a billion people by 2020.
gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] 2014 milestone of 397m reached advances the 2020 billion-people health goal.
gpt5: Rationale: The text links a 2014 milestone to achieving a 2020 target, establishing a short-to-long-term causal chain. Other actions lack explicit multi-scale timing, so no additional cross-scale links were included.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Progress by 2014 and new product roll-outs.; Medium-Term: Goals set for 2020 and multi-year strategies.; Long-Term: Sustainable sourcing and enhancing livelihoods.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term, Long-Term] Short-term progress supports medium-term goals, which in turn influence long-term sustainability efforts.
4o: Rationale: The short-term achievements by 2014 are stepping stones towards the medium-term 2020 goals. These medium-term goals are designed to have long-term impacts on sustainability and livelihoods, creating a clear causal chain across scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Refers to 'by the end of 2014' and specific 'roll-out' of new technology, indicating recent events/progress.; Medium-Term: Refers to goals 'by 2020' (6 years from 2014) and multi-year 'target to halve' impacts.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] Recent progress and technology roll-outs (Short-Term) are explicitly linked to achieving multi-year goals and targets (Medium-Term).
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details how current achievements and recent technological implementations (Short-Term) are directly contributing to or are part of larger, multi-year strategic goals (Medium-Term). No Long-Term interactions were identified as all explicit timeframes fell within the Short-Term or Medium-Term definitions.

Full Paragraph Text: By 2020 our goal is to halve the environmental footprint of the making and use of our products as we grow our business.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a single goal with a specific 2020 deadline (Medium-Term) but lacks explicit causal relationships between different temporal scales. No cross-scale interactions are present.

'Growing our business' is an ongoing, long-term process. Full Paragraph Text: By 2020 we will enhance the livelihoods of millions of people as we grow our business.
claude4: Rationale: The statement presents a single goal with a 2020 timeframe but lacks explicit causal mechanisms showing how short-term actions will achieve this medium-term outcome, or how this goal influences other temporal scales.
gpt5: Rationale: Only one explicit timeframe (“by 2020”) is given, and the causal driver (“grow our business”) has no stated duration. Without two mapped scales, no cross-scale causal link can be established.
4o: Rationale: The statement lacks explicit causal links between different temporal scales. It mentions a future goal but does not specify interactions across short, medium, or long-term scales.

The outcome, 'enhancing the livelihoods of millions of people,' represents a profound, sustained impact over decades, fitting the Long-Term scale. The 'By 2020' acts as a target for the Long-Term outcome, but does not change its inherent scale.

Full Paragraph Text: By 2020 we will help more than a billion people to improve their health and hygiene. This will help reduce the incidence of life-threatening diseases like diarrhoea.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph does not provide explicit causal links between different temporal scales. The timeframe for helping people is not clearly linked to a different scale event or process.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Long-Term] A multi-year initiative to improve health and hygiene for a billion people will lead to a long-term reduction in life-threatening diseases.

This forms a clear causal link between the two distinct temporal scales.

Full Paragraph Text: World population is expected to rise to 8 billion by 2025 and, by then, more than 4 billion will be part of the ‘consuming class’. For the first time the number of people with discretionary income will exceed the number struggling to meet basic needs – a trend described by management consultancy McKinsey as possibly the biggest opportunity in the history of capitalism.

Full Paragraph Text: Cultivation of commodities such as palm oil has contributed to deforestation which has been a major factor behind climate change. This in turn has reduced the availability of raw materials, increasing their price and FMCG production costs.

Full Paragraph Text: Women play a pivotal role in the FMCG market, controlling the majority of purchasing decisions. Significant developments such as the UN’s new Sustainable Development Goals are expected to accelerate these opportunities.

Full Paragraph Text: The trend is being driven in developed and also emerging markets where mobile phones are proving to be one of the most effective ways of delivering advertising to individuals, particularly in the most remote rural locations. For instance, large parts of rural India have no, or very limited, access to television, print or radio. However, mobile phone penetration and usage is high. As a result, Unilever has launched Kan Khajura Mobile Radio Station in India, which delivers radio content to mobile phones through the simple mechanism of giving a missed call.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes current market trends and existing conditions (mobile penetration, media access limitations) along with a specific product launch example, but lacks explicit temporal progression or causal relationships between different time scales.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Unilever has launched Kan Khajura Mobile Radio Station (a discrete action).; Long-Term: Rural India’s limited TV/print/radio access and high mobile penetration are enduring structural conditions.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a current trend and a specific initiative by Unilever, but it does not explicitly link events or processes across different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: The lack of traditional media access and high mobile phone penetration in rural India represent persistent, decades-long conditions.; Short-Term: Unilever's 'launch' of a mobile radio station is a specific, immediate event with effects unfolding over days to a year.

gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that the long-term conditions of limited traditional media access and high mobile phone penetration in rural India were the 'result' or driving force behind Unilever's short-term launch of the Kan Khajura Mobile Radio Station. This establishes a clear causal link from a persistent, decades-long situation to a specific, immediate event. No other explicit cross-scale causal links were identified.

Full Paragraph Text: This mobile channel provides content including Bollywood movie songs, dialogues and jokes that can be interspersed with Unilever brand advertising. Data and analytics are extensively used to vary content to make it relevant and interesting. The channel reaches approximately 10 million people without a TV in Bihar and Jharkhand states, making it one of the largest media channels in these regions. The channel had 29.5 million users by the end of December 2014, helping increase spontaneous awareness of Unilever brands.

While brand awareness building could imply longer-term effects, no clear cross-scale causal mechanisms are stated.

The subsequent impact on brand awareness, while present, is a medium-term to medium-term interaction and thus excluded by the protocol.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 many consumers have faced tough conditions as economic uncertainty has held back growth around the world, both in the developed markets and in emerging markets. Full Paragraph Text: Acting alone Unilever can only do so much to make sustainable living commonplace. Acting in partnership with others it can help bring about transformational change at a societal level to tackle the world’s major social, environmental and economic issues. By adopting a leadership role, and working with governments, NGOs, suppliers and others, we are influencing change on a bigger scale, with a much bigger prize for the business on offer. We are deepening our efforts in three areas where we have scale, influence and resources to create transformational change: deforestation; sustainable agriculture and smallholder farmers; and water, sanitation and hygiene.

At each use, the NR-5 specific ingredients combine to form a fresh supply of enamel mineral which wraps and integrates on to teeth.

gpt5: Rationale: Only 'over time' (long-term) is explicit; no second distinct timeframe is stated, so no cross-scale causal link can be formed.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses strategic goals without specifying concrete events or timeframes that map to different temporal scales, thus no cross-scale link exists.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: The 'strategic role' of a category implies a guiding principle over decades.; Medium-Term: 'continuing to grow ahead of the market' and 'increasing our operating margins over time' are multi-year objectives.

This role explicitly dictates the Medium-Term objectives of 'continuing to grow ahead of the market' and 'increasing our operating margins over time.' Full Paragraph Text: We are well positioned for growth as we look to cater to the opportunities that emerge as a result of global trends. Our footprint and strong competitive position in emerging markets are strong tailwinds and we are identifying segments that emerge. One such segment is wash additives, a segment which is already approximately 12% of the fabric cleaning market in some parts of the developed world and one we have entered in 2014 in Brazil.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Entry into wash additives segment in Brazil in 2014 represents a specific market entry action; Long-Term: Global trends creating opportunities and emerging market segments represent ongoing multi-decade processes
claude4: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Global trends drive specific market entry decisions like entering wash additives in Brazil.
claude4: Rationale: Long-term global trends explicitly create opportunities that result in short-term strategic actions. The company's 2014 entry into Brazil's wash additives market is presented as a direct response to these broader trends and emerging segments.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: “Global trends” are long-run forces causing opportunities.; Short-Term: Concrete action: entry into wash additives in 2014 (single year).
gpt5: Summary: [Long-Term, Short-Term] Global trends create opportunities they act on, evidenced by entering the wash additives segment in 2014 in Brazil.
gpt5: Rationale: The text ties opportunities explicitly to “global trends,” then cites a specific 2014 market entry as acting on such opportunities. No explicit multi-year plan is given, so only Long-Term to Short-Term is linked.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph does not provide explicit causal links between events or processes at different temporal scales. It mentions past actions and current positioning but lacks cross-scale interactions.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Long-Term: Global trends and established market position imply processes unfolding over decades.; Medium-Term: Strategic growth, emerging opportunities, and 2014 market entry are multi-year transitions.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Long-Term, Medium-Term] Global trends and the company's long-term market position explicitly create medium-term growth opportunities and act as strong tailwinds.

Global trends (Long-Term) are stated as the cause for emerging opportunities, which drive medium-term growth strategies. Additionally, the company's long-term established market footprint and competitive position act as strong tailwinds for this medium-term growth. No explicit short-term cross-scale interactions were found.

Full Paragraph Text: Opportunities to upgrade consumers to newer benefits and more convenient formats not only drive growth, but also increase our operating margins by improving the mix of products we sell. A continued focus on delivering our low-cost business model, which unlocks savings across our entire operations, will also contribute to margin expansion, giving us the confidence that we can deliver on our strategic role of increasing the value we generate for Unilever.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Operating margins and product mix improvements from consumer upgrades; Long-Term: Strategic role of increasing value generation for Unilever through sustained business model focus
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Margin improvements from consumer upgrades drive strategic long-term value creation.
claude4: Rationale: The text shows how immediate operational improvements (margin expansion from consumer upgrades and cost savings) explicitly contribute to the overarching strategic objective of long-term value generation for Unilever. The causal link is established through the phrase 'giving us the confidence that we can deliver on our strategic role.'

gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] A sustained low-cost model drives margin expansion, which then supports delivering the strategic goal of increasing long-term value.
gpt5: Rationale: The text links a sustained, structural low-cost model to near-term margin expansion. It then states that this margin expansion enables delivering a strategic, value-increasing role. No medium-term timing is given.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses strategies and outcomes but does not explicitly link events or processes across different temporal scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: Multi-year strategies like improving product mix, low-cost business model, and margin expansion.; Long-Term: The strategic role of increasing value for Unilever, a process unfolding over decades.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Long-Term] Medium-term strategies like margin expansion provide confidence for achieving the long-term strategic goal of increasing value for Unilever.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links multi-year business strategies, such as improving margins through product mix and cost models (Medium-Term), to the confidence required to fulfill the overarching, decades-long strategic role of increasing corporate value (Long-Term). This establishes a clear causal influence from medium-term outcomes to long-term objectives.

Full Paragraph Text: In laundry, we are rolling out our concentrated liquid brands in eco-packs which drive growth, increase the benefit we deliver to our consumers and improve our profitability, while at the same time reducing our environmental impact.

Full Paragraph Text: Eco-packs use less plastic, meaning up to 70% less plastic used and a 50-85% reduction in greenhouse gases per consumer use. Simultaneously, a reduction in plastic packaging delivers a significant cost saving, allowing us to pass on lower costs to our consumers and improve the category profitability. Overall, eco-packs have a significantly lower impact on the environment compared to traditional packaging.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes benefits and impacts of eco-packs but provides no temporal framing or timeframes for when these effects occur. All statements are presented as general facts about eco-pack performance without indicating whether benefits unfold over days, years, or decades.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes benefits of eco-packs but does not explicitly link events or processes across different temporal scales.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Immediate reductions in plastic and greenhouse gases per consumer use lead to a significantly lower long-term environmental impact.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The text describes immediate reductions in plastic and greenhouse gases per consumer use as Short-Term effects. These continuous, per-use reductions are explicitly stated to result in a 'significantly lower impact on the environment,' which is a cumulative Long-Term outcome. This establishes a direct causal link between the immediate operational benefits and the sustained environmental improvement.

Full Paragraph Text: In September 2015 the UN will agree a new set of Sustainable Development Goals. In December Paris hosts the next major UN Climate Change Summit. The close link between human development and climate will focus the world on growth that is more inclusive, sustained and sustainable.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: UN agreements in September 2015 and December 2015 are specific events within one year; Long-Term: Sustained and sustainable growth represents ongoing processes over decades
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] UN climate agreements drive focus toward long-term sustainable growth patterns.
claude4: Rationale: The 2015 UN agreements (short-term events) explicitly cause a shift in global focus toward sustained and sustainable growth (long-term processes). The causal link is established through 'will focus the world on' connecting the immediate policy events to ongoing developmental approaches.
gpt5: Rationale: The text lists short-term 2015 events and a general causal statement about focus, but it does not explicitly link any short-term action to medium- or long-term outcomes. No cross-scale causal wording is present.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes events and intentions without explicit causal links across different temporal scales. No cross-scale interaction is evident.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The agreement of SDGs and the Climate Summit are specific 2015 events, and 'focus the world' is an immediate effect.; Long-Term: Sustainable Development Goals, climate, human development, and 'sustained and sustainable growth' inherently describe processes over decades.

This short-term focus, in turn, is directed towards achieving long-term inclusive and sustainable growth (Long-Term). This forms a clear causal chain across two distinct temporal scales.

Full Paragraph Text: With this in mind, in 2014 Unilever examined where it can bring about improvements on a larger, societal scale by creating transformational change in key areas relevant to our business. These are: • the elimination of deforestation; • championing sustainable agriculture and the development of smallholder farmers; and • improving health and hygiene through handwashing, safe drinking water and sanitation.

The causal link is clear from the text's structure showing how the examination leads to identifying areas for societal-scale transformation.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: “In 2014 Unilever examined…” indicates a within-year action.; Long-Term: “Creating transformational change” in eliminating deforestation, sustainable agriculture, and health/hygiene implies decades-scale societal shifts.

Full Paragraph Text: Sustainability is an integral part of our business model. It meets growing consumer preference for responsible consumption and retailers’ own sustainability targets. It acts as a catalyst for innovation, thus developing new markets, and is an inspiration to Unilever’s current and future employees.

Full Paragraph Text: Unilever is one of the world’s biggest buyers of palm oil as a raw material for use in a number of our Foods and Personal Care brands. Palm oil is recognised as one of the four major commodities driving deforestation, which contributes up to 15% of the world’s greenhouse gas emissions.

claude4: Rationale: Unilever's immediate palm oil procurement activities causally contribute to deforestation, which operates on a long-term scale affecting global greenhouse gas emissions over decades. The causal chain is explicit in the text.
gpt5: Rationale: The text links palm oil to deforestation and deforestation to greenhouse gas emissions, but both are long-term processes and no explicit cross-scale (e.g., short-to-long) causal link is stated.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph does not provide explicit causal links between events or processes at different temporal scales. It mentions deforestation and greenhouse gas emissions but does not establish a cross-scale interaction.

Full Paragraph Text: We have committed to source 100% of our palm oil sustainably from certified, traceable sources by 2020. We also set ourselves the ambition that, by the end of 2014, all the palm oil we buy would be traceable to known sources. On that ambition we still have work to do but we have achieved a significant milestone in our European Foods business.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Traceability ambition by end of 2014 (within 1 year timeframe); Medium-Term: 100% sustainable sourcing commitment by 2020 (multi-year strategy spanning several years)
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] 2014 traceability milestone supports 2020 sustainable palm oil sourcing commitment.
claude4: Rationale: The 2014 traceability ambition represents a foundational short-term step that enables the longer-term 2020 sustainability commitment. The text indicates the traceability work is necessary groundwork for the broader sustainable sourcing goal.
gpt5: Rationale: The text lists a 2014 traceability ambition and a 2020 sustainability commitment, but provides no explicit causal linkage between these different timeframes.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The goal to have all palm oil traceable by the end of 2014 is a short-term target.; Medium-Term: The commitment to source 100% sustainably by 2020 is a medium-term goal.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] The short-term goal of traceability by 2014 supports the medium-term goal of sustainable sourcing by 2020.
4o: Rationale: The paragraph outlines a short-term goal (traceability by 2014) that is a stepping stone towards achieving a medium-term goal (sustainable sourcing by 2020). The explicit link is the dependency of the medium-term goal on the short-term achievement.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The 2014 ambition and current progress on it fall within a 1-year timeframe.; Long-Term: The 2020 commitment is a target set for 6 years after 2014, exceeding 5 years.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Current progress on a short-term traceability ambition directly impacts the achievement of a long-term sustainable sourcing commitment.

This establishes a clear causal interaction between the two distinct temporal scales.

Full Paragraph Text: In June 2014 Unilever, along with fellow members of the Consumer Goods Forum, called on heads of state for a binding global climate change deal. In September 2014 we helped facilitate the New York Declaration on Forests at the UN Climate Summit where more than 170 governments, companies and NGOs pledged to cut forest loss by half by 2020, end it by 2030 and restore 350 million hectares of degraded land.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: June and September 2014 advocacy actions and UN Climate Summit participation; Medium-Term: Forest loss reduction by 2020 and ending by 2030 (6-16 year timeframes)
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Medium-Term] 2014 advocacy efforts enabled multi-year forest conservation commitments with 2020-2030 targets.
claude4: Rationale: The 2014 advocacy actions by Unilever and facilitation of the UN Climate Summit directly resulted in concrete pledges with medium-term targets (2020, 2030). The short-term activities causally enabled the medium-term commitments.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: 2014 actions: calling on heads of state; facilitating the UN forest declaration.; Long-Term: Pledges to halve forest loss by 2020, end by 2030, and restore 350M ha.
gpt5: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] 2014 facilitation of the UN forest declaration produced pledges with 2020/2030 goals and large-scale restoration.
gpt5: Rationale: The text links a 2014 facilitation to explicit pledges with 2020/2030 timelines, a cross-scale causal step. The June 2014 call lacks an explicit downstream effect, so no additional link is drawn.
4o: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: The pledge to cut forest loss by half by 2020 is a short-term goal.; Long-Term: The goal to end forest loss by 2030 and restore land is a long-term objective.
4o: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] The short-term goal of reducing forest loss by 2020 supports the long-term goal of ending it by 2030 and restoring land.
4o: Rationale: The text outlines a short-term goal (cutting forest loss by 2020) that is explicitly linked to a long-term goal (ending forest loss by 2030). This demonstrates a clear cross-scale interaction.

Both events directly resulted in or aimed at establishing long-term commitments and goals, such as a binding global climate change deal and pledges to reduce forest loss by 2020 and 2030. No medium-term interactions were identified as the specified timeframes (2020, 2030) fall under the long-term scale definition.

Full Paragraph Text: Also in the same month, Unilever and the World Resources Institute announced a partnership aimed at increasing transparency in agricultural commodity supply chains. This will enable Unilever and our suppliers to use the Global Forest Watch Commodities platform to monitor forest cover change around commodity supply areas and processing facilities such as palm oil mills.

The announcement occurs at one point in time, and while monitoring implies ongoing activity, no cross-scale causal relationships are explicitly stated.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph describes a partnership and a tool for monitoring, but does not explicitly link events or processes across different temporal scales.

This announcement explicitly 'will enable' the subsequent process of increasing transparency and monitoring forest cover change, which is a strategic, multi-year endeavor fitting the Medium-Term scale. No explicit causal links to a Long-Term scale are present in the text.

Full Paragraph Text: Unilever’s work in moving from commitment to action in combating deforestation has been recognised. In November, we were ranked joint first for corporate action on tackling deforestation in our sector by CDP, formerly the Carbon Disclosure Project. The CDP report was produced on behalf of 240 investors, who together represent US $15 trillion in assets, and analysed the disclosures of 152 companies from around the world. It said: “Companies that regularly respond to CDP’s forests program are now identifying many more opportunities available to them, including securing their supply chain against the risks associated with deforestation and commodity sourcing. This in turn is helping to secure shareholder value.”
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: CDP ranking in November and regular CDP responses represent immediate recognition and reporting activities; Long-Term: Securing supply chain against deforestation risks and protecting shareholder value represent ongoing strategic outcomes
claude4: Summary: [Short-Term, Long-Term] Regular CDP reporting activities enable long-term supply chain security and shareholder value protection.
claude4: Rationale: The text explicitly states that regular CDP responses help companies identify opportunities that secure supply chains and shareholder value over time. This creates a clear causal link from short-term reporting actions to long-term strategic outcomes.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: “are now identifying many more opportunities” indicates immediate effects.; Medium-Term: “securing their supply chain against the risks” implies multi-year actions.; Long-Term: “helping to secure shareholder value” implies enduring outcomes.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 we published our Responsible Sourcing Policy (RSP). The RSP embodies our commitment to conduct business with integrity, openness, and respect for universal human rights and core labour principles. The RSP breaks new ground by defining a ‘continuous improvement ladder’ to help our suppliers move from a base level of ‘do no harm’ to ‘good practice’ and ultimately up to ‘best practice’ and as such is intended progressively to replace our Supplier Code in our dealings with key suppliers. The new code has been introduced to the supply base through communications and engagement from Procurement, and also through targeted events in critical markets such as Brazil, China and Vietnam.

Full Paragraph Text: In his first Independence Day address in 2014, Narendra Modi, India’s new Prime Minister, made a commitment that by 2019 every Indian would have access to a toilet. There are still 46 countries in the world where less than half the population has access to adequate sanitation facilities. 800,000 children die every year from diarrhoea caused by unsafe water, and poor sanitation and hygiene.

4o: Rationale: N/A

All three scales are necessary to capture these explicit causal interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: Transformational change is needed to combat these issues. Unilever is uniquely placed to help because of our expertise in consumer behaviour change, our global reach and our portfolio of health and hygiene brands, including Domestos, Lifebuoy and Pureit, our water purifier. However, bringing about widespread, sustainable behaviour change is not something we can do alone, so we need to work closely with governments, NGOs, academia and funding partners to increase our reach and impact.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph discusses transformational change and sustainable behavior change but provides no explicit timeframes or temporal causality. While 'sustainable' implies longevity, no specific durations are mentioned, and no causal relationships between different temporal scales are established.

4o: Rationale: The paragraph discusses the need for transformational change and collaboration but does not specify events or processes at different temporal scales with explicit causal links.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Medium-Term: The strategy of 'working closely with governments, NGOs, academia and funding partners' implies multi-year collaborative efforts.; Long-Term: 'Transformational change' and 'widespread, sustainable behaviour change' refer to processes unfolding over decades.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Long-Term] Collaborative strategies over multi-years are essential to achieve widespread, sustainable behavior change over decades.

This causal relationship is established by the phrase 'to increase our reach and impact', indicating that the multi-year collaborative efforts directly contribute to the long-term societal transformation. No other explicit cross-scale links were identified.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 we committed to help 25 million people gain improved access to a toilet by 2020. By helping people who don’t have a toilet to get one and by promoting the benefits of using a clean toilet, we will open new markets and drive demand for our products.

The text directly states this multi-year effort 'will open new markets and drive demand,' establishing a clear causal link between the time-bound commitment and ongoing market development.

Full Paragraph Text: Lifebuoy has long championed the health benefits of handwashing with soap and aims to change the hygiene behaviour of 1 billion consumers across Asia, Africa and Latin America. To achieve this ambition, we have to find ways to scale up our programmes: we need to develop lower cost, mass-scale behaviour change approaches and expand our partnerships and co-investment models. Lifebuoy has enjoyed four years of sequential double-digit sales growth.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Short-Term: Four years of sequential double-digit sales growth represents recent performance; Long-Term: Long-term ambition to change hygiene behaviour of 1 billion consumers and long championed health benefits

gpt5: Rationale: No explicit causal link connects time-bounded events across scales. The four-year sales growth and the long-term ambition are stated without a direct causal tie, and the action steps lack a defined timeframe.

4o: Rationale: The short-term success in sales growth is explicitly linked to the long-term ambition of changing hygiene behaviour. The text implies that the current growth is a step towards achieving the larger goal.

gemini2.5: Summary: [Medium-Term, Long-Term] Medium-term strategic developments and partnership expansions are explicitly stated as necessary to achieve the long-term ambition of changing hygiene behavior for 1 billion consumers.

Full Paragraph Text: To date we have trained and recruited more than 3,400 women from nearly 1,100 villages in Pakistan as part of the Guddi Baji (‘Good Sister’) programme. This initiative helps increase sales as well as generating sustainable incomes for women through the sale of Unilever hygiene and personal care brands and through the provision of beauty services to other local women.

Full Paragraph Text: Our programmes also help young women and men. Our Wall’s team has developed a youth employment programme, known as ‘Feet on the Street’, to help tackle the youth jobless rate in Europe while driving our growth agenda by bringing ice cream to the streets. Wall’s provides tools and equipment, such as trikes or push carts and freezers, to enable a micro-entrepreneur to run his or her own mini-business selling ice cream and also to provide young people with their first job experience. In Portugal, Spain and Italy, 250 seasonal jobs were also created to enhance livelihoods while boosting ice cream sales. Our ambition is to have 50,000 micro-entrepreneurs by 2020 with a potential contribution to turnover of more than €100 million.

The current program implementation serves as the foundation for scaling up to the multi-year target.

Separately, short-term seasonal jobs are created to enhance livelihoods, which is a medium-term outcome. All three scales are necessary to capture these interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: Domestos has led our efforts on sanitation in partnership with UNICEF. Our brand, together with the Unilever Foundation, supports UNICEF’s Community Approaches to Total Sanitation (CATS) programme which aims to eliminate open defecation by changing people’s behaviour and promoting demand for sanitation. Domestos contributed 5% of its average proceeds from specially marked bottles on sale in certain markets to UNICEF. Domestos sales continue to grow strongly and were up 7.3% in 2014.

Full Paragraph Text: We believe we can create a brighter future for our children. Project Sunlight is a growing community of people who believe it is possible to build a world where everyone lives well and lives sustainably. The campaign continues to engage people in programmes that can help to contribute to a #brightfuture – almost 180 million ‘acts of sunlight’ were pledged by the end of December 2014.
